dialogue:
#Person1#: I made a reservation earlier this week, but I have to cancel it.
#Person2#: No problem, sir. Just tell me your name, phone number, and date of reservation.
#Person1#: Great! I'm Rudy Randolph, 818-555-1234, and my reservation was for April 9 to 15.
#Person2#: Okay, sir, let me hit the delete button, and your reservation will be cancelled.
#Person1#: That was nice and fast. Thanks.
#Person2#: Not at all.

#Person1#: Are your ready to go to the supermarket?
#Person2#: Yes, are you?
#Person1#: I've got my money and my keys, so I'm ready.
#Person2#: You do know that it's absolutely freezing out, don't you? I'd put a coat on if I were you.
#Person1#: It wasn't cold out this morning.
#Person2#: Well, it's started raining since then. Look out the window! It's pouring rain out there!
#Person1#: Have a look outside for me. Does that look like hail to you?
#Person2#: It does, actually. Maybe we should wait for it to clear up before we go shopping.
#Person1#: That's a good idea. But maybe we should move the car so that the hail doesn't dent it.
#Person2#: Ok. I'll go move the car if you turn the heat on. It's a bit chilly in here.
#Person1#: How long do you think this hailstorm is supposed to last?
#Person2#: I don't know. The weatherman didn't say anything about this in his weather report last night.
#Person1#: Maybe we should turn on the news in case it's supposed to get worse.
#Person2#: I don't think we have anything to worry about. Do you want to put on a cup of tea as well?
#Person1#: Good idea. That will help us to warm up.
#Person2#: If I'm not back in ten minutes, come and find me.
#Person1#: Alright. I'll have a cup of tea waiting for you.

#Person1#: Good morning, Miss Wang. 
#Person2#: Good morning, Mr. Lee. 
#Person1#: It's a beautiful morning, isn't it? 
#Person2#: Oh, it's a nice day, indeed. 
#Person1#: I hope it won't be too hot. I can't stand the heat. 
#Person2#: Really? For me, too.

#Person1#: Why do you want to be a tour guide?
#Person2#: I like to travel and I also like meeting various kinds of people.
#Person1#: What courses have you completed at college?
#Person2#: I have studied English, tourist culture, guiding methods and techniques and so on.
#Person1#: Have you learned any other foreign languages?
#Person2#: Yes, I have learned Japanese as well.
#Person1#: Do you know that is a hard job?
#Person2#: Yes, I know. But I don't mind working hard.
#Person1#: Is there anything you want to ask about?
#Person2#: No. I only wish that you could give me a definite answer to my application as soon as possible.

#Person1#: Hello and welcome to Tasty Table! How may I assist you today?
#Person2#: Hi, I would like to make a reservation for [date|next Friday] at [time|7 pm] for a party of [party size|6] people.
#Person1#: Certainly, I can help you with that. Would you prefer a table inside or outside?
#Person2#: An inside table would be great, thank you.
#Person1#: Perfect, I have made a reservation for you for [date|next Friday] at [time|7 pm] for a party of [party size|6] people, for an inside table. Can I please have your name and a contact number?
#Person2#: Sure. My name is [name|Sarah] and my contact number is [phone number|555-1234].
#Person1#: Great, thank you, [name|Sarah]. Your reservation is confirmed for [date|next Friday] at [time|7 pm] for a party of [party size|6] people, for an inside table, under the name [name|Sarah].   Is there anything else I can assist you with?
#Person2#: Yes, I would also like to order some food now, please. Could you recommend some popular dishes from your menu?
#Person1#: Absolutely! Our menu features a variety of delicious Moroccan dishes. Some popular options include the lamb tagine, the chicken bastilla, and the couscous royal. We also have vegetarian options like the vegetable tagine and the falafel platter.   Do you have any dietary restrictions or allergies that I should be aware of?
#Person2#: Yes, I have a peanut allergy, so I would appreciate it if you could let me know which dishes contain peanuts.
#Person1#: Of course, I'll be happy to assist you with that. We do not use peanuts in our dishes, but some dishes do contain other nuts. Our menu clearly lists all the ingredients for each dish, so you can check for nuts or any other allergens.   Would you like me to point out some dishes that contain nuts or recommend some dishes that are nut-free?
#Person2#: It would be great if you could recommend some nut-free dishes.
#Person1#: Certainly! Here are some delicious nut-free options:  - Lamb tagine - Chicken bastilla - Vegetable tagine - Grilled salmon - Shrimp kebab - Couscous royal  All of these dishes are nut-free but if you have any other dietary restrictions, please let me know and I can help you find a suitable dish.
#Person2#: Thank you for your help! I think I would like to order the Grilled Salmon and the Vegetable Tagine. Would it be possible to add some hummus and pita bread as an appetizer?
#Person1#: Absolutely, that sounds like a great choice! And yes, we do have hummus and pita bread on our menu. Would you like me to add that to your order?
#Person2#: Yes, please add hummus and pita bread to my order. Thank you!
#Person1#: You're welcome! I have added the hummus and pita bread to your order.  Is there anything else I can assist you with?
#Person2#: No, that's it for now. Thank you for your help with the reservation and the menu. I'm looking forward to my meal at Tasty Table!
#Person1#: You're welcome, [name|Sarah]! We're looking forward to having you at Tasty Table. If you have any further questions or requests, don't hesitate to let me know. See you soon!
#Person2#: Thank you, I will definitely let you know if I have any questions or requests. Have a great day!

#Person1#: Hello and welcome to [hotel|The Cursed Castle]. How may I assist you?
#Person2#: Hello! I would like to make a reservation for a room, please.
#Person1#: Certainly! When do you plan on [check in|checking in] and [check out|checking out]?
#Person2#: I would like to [check in|check in] on [date|October 1st] and [check out|check out] on [date|October 4th].
#Person1#: Great! How many guests will be staying in the room?
#Person2#: There will be two guests staying in the room.
#Person1#: Perfect! We have several room options available for your stay. Would you prefer a [room type|standard], [room type|deluxe] or [room type|suite] room?
#Person2#: I would prefer a [room type|deluxe] room, please.
#Person1#: Great choice! The deluxe room rate is $200 per night. Would you like me to go ahead and reserve the room for you?
#Person2#: Yes, please!
#Person1#: Alright, I have reserved a deluxe room for you at [hotel|The Cursed Castle] from [check in|October 1st] to [check out|October 4th] for a total cost of $600. Can I please have your full name and phone number for the reservation?
#Person2#: Certainly! My name is [name|Jane Doe] and my phone number is [phone|555-123-4567].
#Person1#: Thank you for the information, [name|Jane Doe]. Your reservation is confirmed. Is there anything else you need assistance with?
#Person2#: No, that's all for now. Thank you!
#Person1#: You're welcome! Don't hesitate to reach out if you have any further questions or concerns. Have a great day and we look forward to seeing you soon at [hotel|The Cursed Castle]. Goodbye!

#Person1#: You like this china tea set, don't you?
#Person2#: Yes, but can you show me the other colour ones?
#Person1#: Sure. How about the brown one?
#Person2#: No, I don't like the brown one.
#Person1#: The blue one?
#Person2#: Good, I like it.
#Person1#: You've made a good choice. This china tea set is unusual. It was made in Jingdezhen.
#Person2#: It is extremely beautiful. This is the very thing I've been dreaming of. Please put in a gift box for me.
#Person1#: Yes, sir.

#Person1#: Didn't Joe feel it a shame to live on his parents since he has graduated from college? 
#Person2#: He has no sense. 
#Person1#: If I were him, I wouldn't brazen it out by asking my parents for money. 
#Person2#: But Joe won't you.

#Person1#: Could you show me how to operate this fax machine? I am going to receive some urgent fax from a company.
#Person2#: Of course. Let me check it. Firstly, don't be frustrated about all the buttons on it.
#Person1#: That's right.
#Person2#: After overcoming these buttons, you should check whether there is any paper in the machine, you must make sure this.
#Person1#: I couldn't agree more.
#Person2#: And then prepare what you want to receive. If you want to send a photograph, you must copy one.
#Person1#: What can I do next?
#Person2#: The next thing you should do is to wait. The sender will give you the fax.
#Person1#: Look. Some of the faxes come through blurred. What is wrong with it?
#Person2#: Maybe we should call its after-service man.

#Person1#: Daddy, I love this Happy Farmhouse. It's really fun.
#Person2#: Great. But no talking, now. Don't forget that you are on a ladder. Take care!
#Person1#: But you are holding it for me. Nothing to worry about. I trust you. Oops, what's that?
#Person2#: Don't touch it with your stick. It's a bumble bees' hive. Get down the ladder. Be quick.
#Person1#: What would happen if they started attacking you?
#Person2#: You can get killed. No kidding. Remember, never stir up a hive.
#Person1#: I see. Why do people come all the way here to pick apples by themselves and take them home? Isn't it easier for them to buy the apples in the supermarket?
#Person2#: It's for fun. And also, the apples here are Green Food.
#Person1#: Come on, daddy. You can see that people only pick the red ones.
#Person2#: Silly boy. Green Food means the plants grown without using any chemicals, fertilizers, and pesticides.
#Person1#: Oh, then what would happen if there were pests?
#Person2#: I heard they used ultraviolet lamp to kill pests.
#Person1#: Cool! Well, let's go over there to join mom. I want to tell her all about the special pests-killing method.

#Person1#: Great! Here's a question for you: How can you fit 10 horses into 9 stables, if each stable can only hold one horse?
#Person2#: One possible solution could be to place one horse in each of the first eight stables, and then place the remaining two horses in the ninth stable. However, this solution assumes that the horses can be comfortable and safe in such close proximity to each other, which may not be the case in reality.
#Person1#: That's a good attempt, but unfortunately, it's not the correct answer. Here's a hint: think outside the box and consider the possibility of using time as a factor.
#Person2#: Thank you for the hint. Here's another attempt: One possible solution could be to place one horse in each of the first nine stables, and then rotate the horses in and out of the stables over time. For example, one horse could be allowed to graze outside while another horse is temporarily placed in its stable, and then the horses could be switched again later. This way, all 10 horses could be accommodated in the 9 stables over time.
#Person1#: Great job! That's the correct answer. You've demonstrated creative thinking and problem-solving skills. Well done!
#Person2#: Thank you! I'm glad I was able to come up with a solution that works. It was a fun challenge!
#Person1#: You're welcome! It was great to see you rise to the challenge and come up with a solution. Keep up the good work! Goodbye!

#Person1#: After you go back to your country, I think I will invite you to my home someday.
#Person2#: Thank you! I would love to!
#Person1#: What's the weather like in your country? I suppose it must be warmer than here.
#Person2#: Oh, yes. We have rather mild winters. It always has much sunshine in winter. But it was very foggy when I left two days ago. I knew it would be colder here, but I thought there would be a lot of snow.
#Person1#: We don't have much snow in winter in Beijing. In fact, we haven't had any so far this winter. The winter is rather long, but the cold is generally not severe. The temperature seldom gets as low as ten below zero Centigrade.
#Person2#: What is the temperature today, do you know?
#Person1#: About freezing point, I think. But the morning's forecast said that we are going to have a very cold spell in the next few days - and the temperature will probably drop to 10 or 15 degrees below zero.
#Person2#: Oh, I'm very lucky that my wife let me take a heavy overcoat.
#Person1#: It is considerate of your wife.
#Person2#: Yes, she is. By the way, what is the best season in Beijing?
#Person1#: Fall is the best season in Beijing. It's neither hot nor cold. The sky is clear and blue. There's hardly any wind, only a slight breeze which is hardly noticeable. And we have plenty of sunshine too.
#Person2#: Really? Then I will come to Beijing in the fall next time.
#Person1#: Good, you are welcome.

#Person1#: Is there a medication you can prescribe to help me with my problem?
#Person2#: There are various choices of blood pressure medication that we can try.
#Person1#: What is available?
#Person2#: We could start with Hydrochlorothiazide, which is a diuretic.
#Person1#: Are there many side effects?
#Person2#: There really are not many side effects. You need to drink a lot of water when you take this pill.
#Person1#: Is that the only medication I need to take?
#Person2#: It might be, but for a while I also want you to take an ACE inhibitor, Lisinopril.
#Person1#: What are the side effects of that drug?
#Person2#: You may have a little bit of a dry cough, but you will feel much better.

#Person1#: Mary, I heard you moved again.
#Person2#: Yeah. I could not stand living here. There is always much noise in the neighborhood.
#Person1#: You mean noise? How could it be?
#Person2#: You know, on weekends when we wanted to have late rise in the morning, our neighbour started to raise Cain.

#Person1#: What position have you held before?
#Person2#: I have been a salesman.
#Person1#: Would you tell me the general description of your present job?
#Person2#: I am in charge of the trading department.
#Person1#: What made you decide to change your job?
#Person2#: I'm working in a small company where further promotion is impossible.
#Person1#: Why do you leave your present company?
#Person2#: I never easily give up something that is valuable. Before I decided to quit that position, I had made a thorough analysis of things like what I would gain and what I would lose here in your company. You know, Shanghai is always a fascinating place to me, full of challenges as well as hopes. In addition to this, I have the specialized knowledge and the necessary experience of making a good. Of course, opportunities to work abroad and a higher salary are also important to me. So I believe it's worthwhile to come here to work.
#Person1#: Why did you pick this organization?
#Person2#: I'm very much interested in the position.
#Person1#: What made you decide to join our company?
#Person2#: I believe I would have better opportunities with a small but rapidly expanding company like yours.

#Person1#: Please point out the painful place with your finger. Is there any relation between the pain and the weather?
#Person2#: Yes, the pain comes more intense when the weather is bad. And the pain comes intense when I walk too much.
#Person1#: Have you ever had any trauma?
#Person2#: Yes, I have.
#Person1#: Does the pian become more intense at night?
#Person2#: Yes, ti does. Just like a needle prick. Besides, the place that hurts often feels cold, too.
#Person1#: Do you have the sensation of ants crawling over the painful part?
#Person2#: Yes, I do.
#Person1#: I'd like to treat you with acupuncture if you agree.
#Person2#: By the way, does acupuncture hurt?
#Person1#: Acupuncture may cause just a little pain, but it also causes a certain feeling of numbness and distension. We'll try it every day for seven days. Will that be all right?
#Person2#: Yes. Let's start today.

#Person1#: My history professor says I should think about a job in politics, but I don't think I'd make a good politician.
#Person2#: Why not?
#Person1#: You know me. I'm not good at dealing with people and politicians have to work with people all the time.
#Person2#: That's true. So what do you think you want to do?
#Person1#: I think I will be a good artist. I love painting pictures.
#Person2#: That reminds me of a problem I'm having. You know my parents have a restaurant, right? They want me to be the manager.
#Person1#: And you want to?
#Person2#: No way. A restaurant manager has to manage other people. It would be terrible. I'm too disorganized. Honestly, I want to be a teacher because I like working with kids and I'm good at it.
#Person1#: That's true.

#Person1#: When do children start school in your country?
#Person2#: Normally at six. Before that, they spend several years in the kindergarten or pre-school education center.
#Person1#: But thats only in the cities, isnt it?
#Person2#: Right. In the countryside, things are more complicated.
#Person1#: Can kids in the countryside get equally good benefits and education like those in the cities?
#Person2#: It depends. In some poor, underdeveloped areas, children's education is a problem. Many kids cannot afford to go to school.

#Person1#: Have any plans for the weekend, Tom?
#Person2#: Yeah, I'm going for a hike in the southern Rocky Mountains.
#Person1#: Oh, do you go hiking often?
#Person2#: I go as much as I can. I love hiking because you can really get in touch with nature.
#Person1#: It would be nice to get out of the city. Do you want some company?
#Person2#: Sure. But, it will be a long hike, 30 miles in three days. Have you been hiking before?
#Person1#: Yeah, I go a lot too. I saw a bear and a mountain lion on my last hike.
#Person2#: Wow! You must have been pretty far away from the city.
#Person1#: Yeah, my friend and I hiked in a very wild part of the national forest.
#Person2#: Well, bring him along too. We'll have a great time this weekend.
#Person1#: Thanks, I'll ask him.

#Person1#: Hello! Welcome to [clinic|Smile Clinic]. How may I assist you today?
#Person2#: Hi there! I would like to schedule a dermatology appointment, please.
#Person1#: Of course! We would be happy to schedule an appointment for you. May I have your name and phone number, please?
#Person2#: Yes, my name is [patient name|John] and my phone number is [phone number|555-1234].
#Person1#: Thank you, [patient name|John]. May I know your preferred date and time for the appointment?
#Person2#: I'm available on [appointment date|June 15th] at [appointment time|2:00 PM].
#Person1#: Great! We have an opening on [appointment date|June 15th] at [appointment time|2:00 PM]. Would you like to see a specific doctor or do you have a preference?
#Person2#: I don't have a preference. Can you recommend a doctor for me?
#Person1#: Certainly! We have a team of experienced dermatologists here at [clinic|Smile Clinic]. Dr. [doctor name|Johnson] has been with us for many years and has a great reputation. Would you like me to schedule your appointment with Dr. [doctor name|Johnson]?
#Person2#: Yes, that sounds good. Please schedule my appointment with Dr. [doctor name|Johnson].
#Person1#: Great! I have scheduled your appointment with Dr. [doctor name|Johnson] on [appointment date|June 15th] at [appointment time|2:00 PM]. Please arrive 15 minutes early to fill out any necessary paperwork. Is there anything else I can assist you with?
#Person2#: No, that's all for now. Thank you for your help!
#Person1#: You're welcome, [patient name|John]. We look forward to seeing you on [appointment date|June 15th] at [appointment time|2:00 PM]. If you have any further questions or concerns, please don't hesitate to contact us. Have a great day! Goodbye.

#Person1#: I haven't missed one day of school this year. I'm trying to get the prize for perfect attendance!
#Person2#: Great! It's still early in the year, but if you don't get sick, I know you can win.
#Person1#: I'm going to get my homework done and go to bed early every night so I can win!

#Person1#: Do you want to sign for a Korea language class?
#Person2#: What for? Oh, I see, you mean next year our company will expand business to the South Korea market.
#Person1#: Right, we have located a business partner in Seoul. The first contact proves to be successful. The general manager of South Korean company has scheduled to pay a visit to us next month. I think it is quite possible to set up a joint venture company with them soon.
#Person2#: Well, sounds promising. But I think our company will provide us with the language training courses if it is necessary. We need not bother signing for the language by ourselves.
#Person1#: A slow sparrow should make an early start. You know, I am not quick at learning any language.

#Person1#: Oh, Mary, come in, please. I'm so happy to see you.
#Person2#: Happy birthday, George. Many happy returns of the day. Here's a present for you.
#Person1#: Oh, thank you, Mary. You're so nice.
#Person2#: I hope you like it. Oh, have the other guys arrived?
#Person1#: They're all waiting for you. Let's join them. I'm going to cut the cake soon.
#Person2#: Let's go.

#Person1#: Hi, Jack, are you doing anything on Friday night?
#Person2#: Hmm, Friday night?
#Person1#: Yes, the day after tomorrow.
#Person2#: Let me think. Well, I have an appointment with Professor Smith in the morning. And I will attend a lecture in the afternoon. And, oh, yes, my brother just called to say he would fly here that night. I told him I would pick him up.
#Person1#: Oh, that's too bad.
#Person2#: What's the matter?
#Person1#: Well, it's my birthday. I'm having dinner with Joyce and I thought I'd invite more friends and make it a party.
#Person2#: See, I'm really sorry, but I won't be able to make it.
#Person1#: I'm sorry, too. But that's OK.

#Person1#: Is there someone I can talk to about a payment question?
#Person2#: Yes, we can handle that here. How can I help you?
#Person1#: My paycheck that just arrived is less than last week's check.
#Person2#: Did you work at all during the last pay period?
#Person1#: Yes, actually, I did make a little bit of money.
#Person2#: Did you report it on your Continued Claim Form?
#Person1#: Yes, I showed that income on the Continued Claim Form.
#Person2#: Well, we deducted a portion of the income that you made from this week's check.
#Person1#: Maybe I just shouldn't show the income then.
#Person2#: That is cheating and, if you get caught, you will be fined and disqualified from collecting unemployment.

#Person1#: Have you booked a table, madam?
#Person2#: Yes, we've booked one for two. The name is Morrison.
#Person1#: Oh, yes, we have the table for you near the group. This way, please.
#Person2#: The music group? I can't stand the noisy places. Now where's the menu?
#Person1#: It's on the wall, madam, on the blackboard.
#Person2#: Indeed. I suppose you can't afford proper menus.
#Person1#: I'm sorry, madam, but that's what we always do.
#Person2#: Oh, If I weren't so hungry, I would leave immediately.

#Person1#: John, I'd like you to meet Charles Brown, our new manager at the airport. 
#Person2#: Yes, certainly. How can I recognize him? 
#Person1#: He is short, well-built, and he's got light blond hair. 
#Person2#: Is there anything else? 
#Person1#: He has a mustache, if I remember correctly, and a light complexion. 
#Person2#: How old is he? 
#Person1#: He is in his late thirties. 
#Person2#: Well. I shouldn't have any trouble recognizing him. What time does his flight arrive? 
#Person1#: At two thirty.

#Person1#: What was the last movie you saw?
#Person2#: A Korean film called Friends, starring Sang Dong-gun.
#Person1#: Really? I've seen that movie, too.
#Person2#: How did you like the movie?
#Person1#: I thought it was pretty good.
#Person2#: Really? I can't say I agree.
#Person1#: You're kidding. The story and acting were outstanding.
#Person2#: I guess I expected too much from the movie, so I was a bit disappointed.
#Person1#: I guess it could happen.

#Person1#: Hey, Ted. What are you up to this Friday?
#Person2#: Well, I have the day off from work.
#Person1#: That's great! Do you have any plans?
#Person2#: Well, I'Ve been working so hard lately, so I'll probably just take it easy.
#Person1#: Sounds nice.
#Person2#: Yeah, I'll probably just stay in and relax. Maybe watch a few movies.
#Person1#: Can I stop by?
#Person2#: Sure. Any time.

#Person1#: What's the plot of your new movie?
#Person2#: It's a story about a policemen who is investigating a series of strange murders. I play the part of the detective. He has to catch the killer, but there's very little evidence. It's a psychological th
#Person1#: Did you enjoy making the movie? We heard stories of disagreement with other actors and with the director.
#Person2#: I have had disagreement with every director. I'Ve worked with. We'Ve always disagreed in a friendly way and we have always resolved our differences. It was the same when I made this movie. I don't no
#Person1#: Critics are not very happy with the movies that you'Ve made recently. Does that bother you?
#Person2#: Not at all. The feedback from audience has been great. I care about what they think more than what the critics think.
#Person1#: Did you do you own stunts in the movie?
#Person2#: I wanted to, but my insurance company wouldn't let me. All of my stunts were done by a stuntman. As you know, I used to do my own stunts, but I'll leave that to the experts in future.
#Person1#: Thank you very much for doing this interview.
#Person2#: My pleasure. Have you seen the movie yet?
#Person1#: Yes. I have. I liked it very much. Like you, I was very impressed with Rachel's performance in the movie. She's going to be a star.

#Person1#: We do a lot of camping in the mountains. What would you recommend for two people?
#Person2#: You'd probably be better off with the four reel drive vehicle. We have several off-road trucks in stock, both new and used.

#Person1#: Hello! Welcome to [clinic|Being Strong Center]. How may I assist you today?
#Person2#: Hi, I would like to schedule a dermatology appointment, please.
#Person1#: Sure, I'd be happy to help you with that. May I have your name and phone number, please?
#Person2#: Yes, my name is [patient name|John] and my phone number is [phone number|555-1234].
#Person1#: Thank you, John. May I know your preferred date and time for the appointment?
#Person2#: I would prefer to schedule the appointment for [appointment date|next Monday] at [appointment time|2:00 PM], if possible.
#Person1#: I'm sorry, but we don't have any available slots at that time. However, we do have an opening at [appointment time|10:00 AM] on [appointment date|next Monday]. Would that work for you?
#Person2#: Yes, that works for me. Can you please confirm the appointment details, including the doctor's name and the reason for the visit?
#Person1#: Of course, John. You are scheduled to see [doctor name|Dr. Lee] on [appointment date|next Monday] at [appointment time|10:00 AM]. May I know the reason for your visit?
#Person2#: Yes, I have been experiencing some skin irritation and would like to have it checked out.
#Person1#: I see. Dr. Lee will be able to help you with that. Do you have any insurance that you would like us to bill for the appointment?
#Person2#: Yes, I have [insurance|XYZ Insurance]. Can you please confirm if this is accepted at your clinic?
#Person1#: Yes, we do accept [insurance|XYZ Insurance]. Please bring your insurance card with you to the appointment so we can verify your coverage. Is there anything else I can assist you with?
#Person2#: No, that's all. Thank you for your help!
#Person1#: You're welcome, John. We look forward to seeing you on [appointment date|next Monday] at [appointment time|10:00 AM]. If you have any further questions or concerns, please don't hesitate to contact us. Goodbye!

#Person1#: Would you like to order anything else?
#Person2#: No, I'm good. All we need now is our check.
#Person1#: Our waitress has been kind of scarce tonight, hasn't she?
#Person2#: I think that is our waitress is over by the bar. Boy, the service has not been good this evening.
#Person1#: She doesn't appear to be headed this way, so I will go get the check.
#Person2#: Good. Just bring it back and we'll total it together.
#Person1#: Our total for dinner is $ 36. 00.
#Person2#: What do you think would be the right amount to tip?
#Person1#: I kind of don't want to leave any tip for the lousy service we received.
#Person2#: I agree that it was bad service, but I heard one of the other waiters mentioning that it was our server's first night on the job.
#Person1#: I believe that 10 % is just about right amount.
#Person2#: I think that a tip of $ 3. 60 will be the right amount to leave.

#Person1#: I am going on my first date tonight. Can you give me some suggestions about what to wear?
#Person2#: Well, I think you look very pretty in your polka dot purple dress with your hair piled at the rear. That makes you very graceful and mysterious.
#Person1#: Yeah, that's a good idea. Let me try it.
#Person2#: Remember to match it with your glittering star-shaped necklace. Very attractive on formal occasions.
#Person1#: Do I look more mature in the highheel shoes?
#Person2#: Sure, more elegant and taller.
#Person1#: I shall wear light make-up instead of heavy. The face powder will lighten my skin color.

#Person1#: I'm planning to buy a bicycle. As you are quite a cycling enthusiast, I wish you might give me some advice. 
#Person2#: With pleasure, chap. But before I start, I need to know what you want a bike for? 
#Person1#: My purposes are two-fold. On the one hand, I've grown bored of commuting on suffocating buses every day and decided to ride to work. On the other hand, bicycling is a sport, and I intend to build up my body through constantly taking a ride over the weekends. 
#Person2#: Cycling during weekends? Do you me riding on the mountainous countryside orjust the neighboring towns? 
#Person1#: Does that make any difference? 
#Person2#: Can't be greater. If you ride on bumpy, hilly roads, a mountain bike is what you need. But if you just ride comfortably along the city lanes, you might choose a road bike. 
#Person1#: Are they designed differently? 
#Person2#: A road bike features skinny tires and a light-weight frame. Its riding position puts you bent over the handlebars. It's not particularly beefy in construction, and generally, it won't stand up well under heavy loads or on really rough surfaces. In contrast, mountain bikes have wide tires and a stout frame. You sit higher on them and don't have to hunched over.

Overall, it is difficult to say exactly how the world would be different today if Napoleon had won the Battle

#Person1#: Excuse me. May I see Mrs. Smith?

#Person1#: Nice to meet you, Mrs. Smith. I'm coming here for an interview by appointment.
#Person2#: Are you Mr. Wu?
#Person1#: Yes, I am.
#Person2#: Nice to meet you, too. Did you have any difficulty finding our company?
#Person1#: Not really, I am familiar with this area.

#Person1#: John, do you have a minute?
#Person2#: Oh, hi, Leo. Sure, what's up?
#Person1#: Well, I'Ve been meaning to talk to you about the situation in the office.
#Person2#: I'm not in there very often. It's so noisy that I can't work.
#Person1#: That's exactly what I'm getting at. We're supposed to be able to do our preparation and marking in that office, but have you noticed? Jack constantly has students coming in to get help with his course. A lot people are going in and out.
#Person2#: Has anybody spoken to him about it?
#Person1#: No, not yet, but someone's going to have to.
#Person2#: We can't really ask him to stop having students come in for help, can we?
#Person1#: No, of course not. But I'm not able to do my work and neither are you.
#Person2#: How about recommending him to use the storage room down the hall?
#Person1#: Oh, that would be too small.
#Person2#: With the cabinets taken out, it might be bigger than it looks.
#Person1#: Come to think of it, you may be on to something. Let's go have a look.
#Person2#: Let's rock n'roll.

#Person1#: Next, please.
#Person2#: Hi, I bought this DVD player here last Saturday, but it's not working properly.
#Person1#: What's the matter with it?
#Person2#: Well, several things. First of all, the remote doesn't work.
#Person1#: Did you put batteries in it?
#Person2#: Yes, of course. But it still didn't work. I couldn't change any of the functions on the display. It also doesn't fast forward when I'm playing a DVD.
#Person1#: Well, I'm sure that it's just a problem with this one player. I've never seen this with any of the models made by this brand. Do you want any of exchange it or return it?
#Person2#: I'd like to return it.
#Person1#: OK. Do you have the receipt?
#Person2#: Yes, here it is.

#Person1#: Come in and sit down.
#Person2#: Thanks, Mr. Liang.
#Person1#: Among all the assistants, I think you're on top of it. Based on the annual evaluation, the board of directors decided to give you a bonus.
#Person2#: Really? I am too happy.
#Person1#: I've been reviewing your work over the past few months. Thanks to your excellent work, we benefit much from your project. And you should get the perfect attendance award too.
#Person2#: Thanks for your trust. Owing to my colleagues ' help, I've successfully completed my task.
#Person1#: You are very modest and diligent. The distribution of bonus derived from the performance evaluation. You deserve it.
#Person2#: Thank you very much. I will redouble my efforts in the future.

#Person1#: Hello and welcome to Tasty Table! How may I assist you today?
#Person2#: Hi, I would like to make a reservation for [party size|4] people for [reservation date|this Saturday] at [reservation time|7 PM].
#Person1#: Certainly, I can make a reservation for [party size|4] people on [reservation date|this Saturday] at [reservation time|7 PM]. May I have your name, please?
#Person2#: Yes, my name is [name|Sarah].
#Person1#: Thank you, [name|Sarah]. Your reservation for [party size|4] people on [reservation date|this Saturday] at [reservation time|7 PM] is confirmed. Is there anything else I can assist you with?
#Person2#: Yes, I would also like to order some food. Can you recommend any popular dishes?
#Person1#: Certainly, we have many popular dishes here at Tasty Table. Our [menu item|Lamb Tagine] is a traditional Moroccan dish that is very popular among our customers. Our [menu item|Grilled Salmon] is also a favorite among seafood lovers. If you're looking for something vegetarian, our [menu item|Vegetable Couscous] is a great option. Do any of these sound appealing to you?
#Person2#: The [menu item|Lamb Tagine] sounds delicious. I'll have that, please.
#Person1#: Great choice! Our [menu item|Lamb Tagine] is a slow-cooked lamb dish with apricots, almonds, and Moroccan spices. Would you like any appetizers or drinks to go with that?
#Person2#: Yes, I would like to start with the [menu item|Hummus] appetizer and a glass of [drink|Moroccan Mint Tea].
#Person1#: Excellent choices! Our [menu item|Hummus] is a creamy chickpea dip served with warm pita bread, and our [drink|Moroccan Mint Tea] is a refreshing and traditional drink. Is there anything else I can assist you with?
#Person2#: No, that's all for now. Thank you for your help!
#Person1#: You're welcome, [name|Sarah]. Your order for [menu item|Hummus], a glass of [drink|Moroccan Mint Tea], and [menu item|Lamb Tagine] has been noted. If you have any allergies or special requests, please let me know. Otherwise, we'll see you on [reservation date|this Saturday] at [reservation time|7 PM]. Goodbye!

#Person1#: Onxiu Travel Agency, may I help you?
#Person2#: Yes. I'd like to make a plane reservation to Shanghai, China.
#Person1#: Your name, please?
#Person2#: Via Kiang. I'd like to leave on May 5th.
#Person1#: Let me see what's available. Yes, Air China has a flight on May 5th at nine fifteen in the morning.
#Person2#: Well, I need an economy ticket.
#Person1#: Single ticket or return ticket?
#Person2#: Single. What's the fare, PLS?
#Person1#: Economy fare for single ticket from Beijing to Shanghai is 500 yuan.
#Person2#: I see. Is my ticket confirmed then?
#Person1#: Yes, your seat is confirmed on that flight. Pls arrive at the airport one hour before departure.
#Person2#: Thank you.

#Person1#: I would like to make an offer on this house, but I don't know much about the process.
#Person2#: As your realtor, I am here to take care of this process. How much were you planning on offering?
#Person1#: I really like the house and will pay the full asking price of three hundred and fifty thousand dollars.
#Person2#: We want to leave ourselves some bargaining room. Let's offer three hundred and twenty thousand dollars.
#Person1#: That sounds good, but I don't want this house to get away from me.
#Person2#: The market is fairly down right now, so the offer is a realistic one.
#Person1#: When will we know if they accept the offer?
#Person2#: The owners usually respond to an offer within a few days.
#Person1#: Should I be contacting my bank in the meantime?
#Person2#: You are already pre-qualified for your loan, so you are in good shape.

#Person1#: Hello! Welcome to [clinic|Smile Clinic]. How may I assist you today?
#Person2#: Hello! I would like to make a dental appointment, please.
#Person1#: Great! We'd be happy to help you with that. May I have your name, please?
#Person2#: Yes, my name is [patient name|John].
#Person1#: Thank you, John. When would you like to schedule your appointment?
#Person2#: I would like to schedule it for [appointment date|next Monday], if possible.
#Person1#: Sure, I can check our schedule for you. We have availability at 11:00 am and 3:00 pm. Which time would work better for you?
#Person2#: 11:00 am works better for me.
#Person1#: Alright, John. We have you scheduled for a dental appointment on [appointment date|next Monday] at 11:00 am. Is there anything else I can help you with?
#Person2#: Yes, please. Could you tell me the name of the dentist I'll be seeing?
#Person1#: Certainly, John. You'll be seeing [doctor name|Dr. Lee]. She's a highly qualified dentist and I'm sure you'll be in good hands.
#Person2#: Great, thank you for letting me know. One more thing, will I need to bring any documentation or my insurance card with me to the appointment?
#Person1#: Yes, John. Please bring a valid ID and your insurance card with you to your appointment. If you have any medical history records or previous dental records, please bring them as well. It will help us to better understand your dental health history.
#Person2#: Understood. Thank you so much for your help.
#Person1#: You're welcome, John. Is there anything else I can assist you with today?
#Person2#: No, that's all. Thank you for your time and assistance. Have a great day!
#Person1#: You're welcome, John. We look forward to seeing you next Monday. If you have any questions or concerns before your appointment, don't hesitate to contact us. Have a great day! Goodbye!

#Person1#: Daniel, have you ever heard about the wildlife sanctuary? 
#Person2#: Is that different from this kind of zoo? 
#Person1#: Yes, of course. 
#Person2#: So tell me about it! 
#Person1#: There are a lot of wild animals in that place, and also some special rules while visiting. 
#Person2#: Special rules? 
#Person1#: There, you only have two ways for visiting. 
#Person2#: Details? 
#Person1#: On their bus or in your own cars, and you won't be allowed to get off the bus until you reach the special region. 
#Person2#: Why not? 
#Person1#: Because it is dangerous to get out of the car or bus. You can just imagine how fierce the wild animals can be. 
#Person2#: That makes sense. But that sounds interesting. Is there one in Beijing too? 
#Person1#: Yes. 
#Person2#: I prefer to go there next time. 
#Person1#: Yeah, sure, you won't be disappointed.

#Person2#: The yellow one? Why?
#Person1#: Because it makes me feel relaxed and look confident.
#Person2#: Ok, perhaps you should wear a black hat and blue jeans.
#Person1#: You mean a yellow T-shirt with a black hat and blue jeans? That's a good choice.
#Person2#: Yeah, you must be a star at the party.

#Person1#: Hi, my name is Lean, and I'm from Russia.

#Person1#: To me English is a difficult language.
#Person2#: A second language is always difficult.
#Person1#: True, but English is harder than most. It's a crazy language.
#Person2#: A crazy language? Why do you say that?
#Person1#: One letter can have several pronunciations and one word can have several meanings.
#Person2#: No wonder you say English is a crazy language.

#Person1#: Hello and welcome to Furry Friends pet care service! How can I assist you today?
#Person2#: Hi, I'm interested in booking a pet care service for my dog. Can you please tell me what services you offer and the corresponding rates?
#Person1#: Absolutely! We offer a variety of pet care services including grooming, boarding, daycare, and walking. Our rates vary depending on the service and the duration. For grooming, the rates start at $50 for a basic grooming session and increase depending on the size of the dog and the complexity of the grooming requested. For boarding, the rates start at $35 per night and increase depending on the size of the dog and the length of stay. For daycare, the rates start at $25 per day and increase depending on the length of stay. For walking, the rates start at $20 for a 30-minute walk and increase depending on the duration and distance. Do you have any other questions or would you like to book a service?
#Person2#: Thank you for the information. I would like to book a grooming session for my dog. Can you please tell me what dates and times are available?
#Person1#: Sure! Can you please provide me with the preferred date and time for the grooming session? We are open from Monday to Sunday, 9 AM to 6 PM.
#Person2#: I would like to schedule the grooming session for this Thursday at 10 AM. Is that time slot available?
#Person1#: Let me check our schedule. Yes, we have an available slot for a grooming service this Thursday at 10 AM. Would you like to proceed with the booking?
#Person2#: Yes, please! Can you please tell me what information you need to make the booking?
#Person1#: Sure! To book a grooming session, we would need your dog's name, breed, age, and any special requests or conditions. You will also need to provide your name, phone number, and email address for us to be able to contact you in case we need to.
#Person2#: Great! My dog's name is Max, he is a Labrador Retriever, and he is 3 years old. He doesn't have any special requests or conditions. My name is Sarah, my phone number is 123-456-7890, and my email address is sarah@email.com.
#Person1#: Thank you, Sarah! We have successfully booked a grooming session for Max, your Labrador Retriever, this Thursday at 10 AM. The total cost for the service is $50. Do you have any other questions or concerns?
#Person2#: No, that's all for now. Thank you for your help!
#Person1#: You're welcome, Sarah! We look forward to seeing Max soon. Have a great day! Goodbye.

#Person1#: Hi, Mary, you have been a secretary for several years in this company. Could you tell me what a secretary should do for a meeting or a conference?

#Person1#: I see, and how about the documents and the information?
#Person2#: All the necessary documents and the information relevant to the meeting should be available, preferably printed and distributed before the meeting.
#Person1#: And what should a secretary do during the meeting?
#Person2#: Of course, she should take minutes.
#Person1#: And after the meeting?
#Person2#: After the meeting she should type the minutes up, and then keep proper records of the business transacted and the resolutions passed and also implement many of the decision reached at the meeting.

#Person1#: Great! Here it is: A man is pushing his car along a road when he comes to a hotel. He shouts, "I'm bankrupt!" Why?

#Person2#: Thank you for the hint. Based on the information provided, it seems like the man is not actually bankrupt, but he shouts that he is bankrupt. One possibility could be that the man was playing a board game like Monopoly, where one of the game's rules is that a player who goes bankrupt loses the game. However, without further information, it is difficult to determine the exact reason why the man shouted that he is bankrupt.
#Person1#: That's a good guess, but not quite the answer I was looking for. Here's another hint: The man is not alone and there is a specific reason why he shouts that he is bankrupt.
#Person2#: Thank you for the additional hint. Based on the new information, it seems like the man is not alone, and there is a specific reason why he shouts that he is bankrupt. One possibility could be that the man is playing a game with his friends, and he has lost the game. As a result, he shouts that he is bankrupt, indicating that he has lost the game. Another possibility could be that the man is in a race, and he is pushing his car because it has run out of gas. When he reaches the hotel, he realizes that he cannot continue the race because he does not have enough money to buy more gas. Therefore, he shouts that he is bankrupt.
#Person1#: Great job! The second possibility you mentioned is the correct answer. The man is playing a game where he has to push his car along a road, and he runs out of gas just in front of a hotel. He realizes that he doesn't have enough money to buy more gas, so he shouts "I'm bankrupt!" to indicate that he can't continue the game. Well done!
#Person2#: Thank you! I'm glad I was able to figure it out. It was a fun and interesting puzzle to solve. Let me know if you have any other questions or puzzles you'd like me to help with.
#Person1#: Thank you for your willingness to help! That was the only puzzle I had for now. It was great working with you. Goodbye!

#Person1#: Great! Here's the question: Imagine you have a cube made up of smaller cubes. If you paint the outside of the cube, how many of the smaller cubes will have at least one face painted?
#Person2#: Sure, I can help you with that. Let me clarify a few things first. Is the cube made up of smaller cubes such that there is only one layer of cubes on the outside, or are there multiple layers of cubes?
#Person1#: The cube is made up of smaller cubes such that there is only one layer of cubes on the outside.
#Person2#: Okay, got it. So, if there is only one layer of cubes on the outside, then we can calculate the number of cubes with at least one face painted by counting the number of cubes on the edges and corners of the cube.   Each edge of the cube has 4 cubes with at least one face painted, and there are 12 edges in total. So, there are 12 x 4 = 48 cubes on the edges with at least one face painted.  Each corner of the cube has 3 cubes with at least one face painted, and there are 8 corners in total. So, there are 8 x 3 = 24 cubes on the corners with at least one face painted.  Therefore, the total number of cubes with at least one face painted is 48 + 24 = 72.
#Person1#: Great job! That's the correct answer.
#Person2#: Thank you! I'm glad I could help. Do you have any other questions or is there anything else I can help you with?
#Person1#: No, that was a great answer. Thank you for your help! Goodbye!

#Person2#: This is a classic probability problem known as the Monty Hall problem. The answer is that you should switch to the other unopened door. Now, the only two doors remaining are the one you initially picked and the other unopened door. #Person1#: Great! Here's the question: What do these words have in common: polish, job, herb?
#Person2#: The commonality between these words is that the first letters of each word are pronounced differently than their usual pronunciation. In other words, the "p" in "polish," the "j" in "job," and the "h" in "herb" are all silent.
#Person1#: That's a good observation, but that's not the answer I was looking for. There's another commonality between these words that is more specific. Do you want a hint?
#Person2#: Yes, please. A hint would be helpful.
#Person1#: The answer has to do with the language from which these words originate.
#Person2#: Thank you for the hint. Based on that, I believe the commonality between these words is that they are all borrowed from the Polish language.
#Person1#: That's a good guess, but it's not correct. The words "polish" and "job" are of Slavic origin, but not specifically Polish. The word "herb" is of French origin. Do you want another hint?
#Person2#: Yes, please. Another hint would be helpful.
#Person1#: The commonality between these words has to do with the way they are pronounced in American English.
#Person2#: Thank you for the hint. Based on that, I believe the commonality between these words is that the stress is on the second syllable of each word in American English.
#Person1#: That's correct! In American English, the stress is on the second syllable of each of these words. "Polish" is pronounced "POH-lish," "job" is pronounced "JAHB," and "herb" is pronounced "ERB." Well done!
#Person2#: Thank you! I'm glad I was able to figure it out with your hints. It was a fun challenge!
#Person1#: You're welcome! I'm glad you enjoyed the challenge. It was great working with you. Goodbye!

#Person1#: what do you think about the public service advertisement for quiting smoking?

#Person1#: it's a pun. They use the fish hook to make you think about how you can get hooked on smoking.
#Person2#: I know, but I think it's not really appropriate for young children.
#Person1#: I think they're trying to scare the young people so that they don't ever start smoking.
#Person2#: all advertisers like to catch young people because they know the meaning of loyalty.
#Person1#: perhaps you're right, , though. Maybe the advertisement would be more effective with adults anyhow.
#Person2#: I have nothing against them putting the advertisements in magazines and newspapers that are read by adults, but I don't think they should have their ad on billboards where children can see them.
#Person1#: that's a good point. I think I was so delighted to see that a billboard was being used to promote health that I didn't think about how children might understand the ad.
#Person2#: you have to give them credit, though. It's about time people started becoming more aware of the dangers of smoking.

#Person1#: Come in, please. 
#Person2#: Good moring, Mrs. Smith. 
#Person1#: Good moring. You are Mr. Sun, aren't you? Take a seat, please. 
#Person2#: Yes, thank you. 
#Person1#: I've noticed from your resume that you majored in accounting at Peking University. Will you please tell me something about your related courses? 
#Person2#: In the first academic year we learned Principles of Accounting, and in the following years we learned Cost Accounting, Commercial Accounting, Industrial Accounting, and Mangagement Accounting. 
#Person1#: Have you taken Accounting for Decision-Making and Control? 
#Person2#: No, we haven't taken such a course, but we have taken a more specialized course for decision making, by the name of Forecasting and Decision-Making. 
#Person1#: From your school report card, I can see you did well in every course. But our advertisement says we need an accountant with practical work experience. 
#Person2#: I forgot to include my experience as an accountant in my resume. In fact, I took a part-time job as an accountant at the Atlantic Trading Company during my second and third school year. I worked three evenings a week there and I did quite well. Here is the recommendation. 
#Person1#: You can speak English fluently but I wonder if you can deal with bookkeeping and accounting in English. 
#Person2#: No problem. The professional English course is just English for Accounting. Moreover, as you know, the Atlantic Trading Company is a Sino-Australian joint venture. When I served part-time there, I became well acquainted with accounting operated in English. 
#Person1#: That sounds fine. Why did you choose to apply to our company? 
#Person2#: I have a relative working as a manager in your manufacturing department. Her name is Liuling. She told me a lot about your company and I became quite interested. I believe I can have a promising career with the development of this company. 
#Person1#: Do you know something about the payment we give to our employees? 
#Person2#: No, can you tell me about it? 
#Person1#: Of course. As for an entry-level accountant, we pay $ 1, 500 a month in the first half year. We have a grading system to evaluate your work. If you have made progress, we will certainly raise your salary. For beginners with a CPA certificate, they can earn at least $ 3, 000 a month. 
#Person2#: I have passed the five courses required by the Chinese CPA Association, but the certificate won't come to hand until next month. How about that? 
#Person1#: I hope you can show me your CPA certificate before we reach a decision by the end of July. 
#Person2#: Thank you, Mrs. Smith. It is really a pleasure talking with you. 
#Person1#: The same for me. We'll keep in touch with you. 
#Person2#: Thank you. Good-bye.

#Person1#: Great! Here it is: A man is pushing his car along a road when he comes to a hotel. He shouts, "I'm bankrupt!" Why?
#Person2#: Hmm, this is an interesting riddle. Let me think.   If the man is pushing his car along the road, it means that the car is not working or out of fuel. The fact that he comes across a hotel is probably not relevant.   As for shouting "I'm bankrupt!", it seems like an odd thing to say in this situation. Perhaps he is indicating that he cannot afford to fix his car or pay for a room at the hotel?   I'm not entirely sure, could you provide any additional hints or information?
#Person1#: You are on the right track. The hotel is actually relevant to the answer. Think about the man's financial situation and how it relates to the hotel.
#Person2#: Ah, I see. So the hotel is relevant to the answer.   If the man is bankrupt, it means that he has no money or is in a very bad financial situation. Perhaps the hotel is a luxury hotel, and the man cannot afford to stay there?   In that case, shouting "I'm bankrupt!" might be his way of expressing frustration or despair at his financial situation, as he cannot afford to stay at the hotel.   Does that sound like a possible answer?
#Person1#: That is a good attempt, but not quite the answer. Let me give you another hint: What if I told you that the man's bankruptcy was not related to his financial situation?
#Person2#: Interesting! So the man's bankruptcy is not related to his financial situation.   In that case, perhaps the word "bankrupt" is being used in a different sense. Could it be a play on words?   For example, is it possible that the man's car is a type of car called a "Bankrupt" and he is shouting that he is pushing his "Bankrupt" car?   Or maybe the hotel is called "The Bankrupt Hotel" and the man is shouting that he cannot afford to stay there because he is bankrupt in the sense that he has no credit or financial resources to pay for a room?
#Person1#: Great job! You got it right. The man is playing a word game. The car he is pushing is a type of car called a "Bankrupt" and he is shouting that he is pushing his "Bankrupt" car.   Well done, you solved the riddle! Is there anything else I can help you with?
#Person2#: Thank you, I'm glad I was able to solve the riddle! That was a fun challenge.   I don't have any other questions at the moment, but I appreciate your help. Have a great day!
#Person1#: You're welcome! It was my pleasure to help. Don't hesitate to reach out if you have any other questions or challenges in the future. Have a great day too! Goodbye!

These seats are priced at $1200 per ticket. - Section C: located on the sidelines and directly behind Section A. These seats offer great views of the court and are priced at $1000 per ticket. - Section D: located on the sidelines and directly behind Section B. These seats are priced at $700 per ticket. - Section F: located on the sidelines and behind Section D. These seats are the furthest from the court in the lower section but are still great seats. They are priced at $500 per ticket.  I hope this information helps! Let me know if you have any further questions or if you would like me to help you purchase tickets.

You can provide that to me here, or if you prefer, I can send you a secure link to our payment page where you can enter your information directly.  Please note that we take security very seriously, and we only use secure payment systems to ensure your information is safe.

#Person1#: Pretty! Say beautiful rather. Can you imagine any thing nearer perfect beauty than she altogether-face and figure?

What a bloom of full health, and such a pretty height and size ; such a firm and upright figure! There is health, not merely in her bloom, but in her air, her head, her glance. One hears sometimes of a child being'the picture of health'; now, she always gives me the idea of being the complete picture of grown-up health. She is loveliness itself.

#Person1#: Uh, could I borrow a few bucks until payday? I'm a little strapped for cash.
#Person2#: Uh, yeah, I guess, but I'm pinching pennies myself, and you still owe me $20 from last week. And mom and your friend Ron said you borrowed money from them this past week. [Oh, yeah.] How ARE things going anyway?
#Person1#: Well, not very well. To be honest, I'm really in the hole, and I can't seem to make ends meet these days.
#Person2#: What do you mean? I thought you landed a great job recently, so you must be loaded.
#Person1#: Well, I do have a job, but I've used my credit cards to pay off a lot of things recently, but now, I can't seem to pay the money off.
#Person2#: Uh, do you have a budget? I mean, how do you keep track of your income and expenses?
#Person1#: Well, when my money runs out, I come to you. Of course. [Great!] No, but I guess I should have some financial plan.
#Person2#: Well, let me see if I can help you. How much money do you spend on your apartment?
#Person1#: Uh, I pay $890 on rent for the studio apartment downtown ... not including utilities and cable TV. But the place has an awesome view of the city.
#Person2#: Uh, $890! Why are you paying through the nose for such a small place when you could find a cheaper one somewhere outside of the downtown area?
#Person1#: Yeah, I guess.
#Person2#: Okay. How much money do you spend on food a month?
#Person1#: Hmmm. I'm not really sure. I think I spend around $600. [$600?!] Well, I go out to eat at least four times a week, so those expenses add up. I just don't enjoy eating alone, and I don't have a knack for cooking like you do.
#Person2#: Well, I can understand that, but perhaps you ought to buy some microwaveable meals you could prepare at home.
#Person1#: Well, I guess I could.
#Person2#: And entertainment?
#Person1#: Well, I spend a few dollars here and there on basketball and movie tickets, a concert or two, and ballroom dance lessons.
#Person2#: Uh, exactly how much do you spend on all of these? Just a 'few' dollars?
#Person1#: Well, oh ... about $400 or so.
#Person2#: Or so? No wonder you're having money problems. You can't just blow your money on things like that! And what about transportation?
#Person1#: Oh, I commute to work everyday in my new sports car, but I got a great deal, and my monthly payments are only $450. Come outside and take a look. We can go for a spin!
#Person2#: No, I've heard enough. You've got to curb your spending, or you'll end up broke. I suggest you get rid of your credit cards, cut back on your entertainment expenses, and sell your car. Take public transportation from now on.
#Person1#: Sell my car?! I can't date without a car. What am I going to say? 'Uh, could you meet me downtown at the bus stop at 7:00?' Come on!
#Person2#: And you need to create a budget for yourself and stick to it, and start with paying off your bills, starting with me. You owe me $50 dollars.
#Person1#: Fifty dollars! Wait, I only borrowed $20 from you last week. How did you come up with $50?
#Person2#: Financial consulting fees. My advice is at least worth $30!

#Person1#: How about the hiking? It was freezing yesterday, are you all ok?

#Person1#: Hello, welcome to TechHelp. How may I assist you today?
#Person2#: Hi, I am having trouble with my [device name|smartphone]. It seems to be freezing frequently and the apps are crashing. Can you help me with this issue?
#Person1#: Sure, I'd be happy to help. What is the model of your smartphone and what operating system is it running on?
#Person2#: It's an [device name|iPhone X] running on the latest version of [operating system|iOS].
#Person1#: Okay, let's try a few troubleshooting steps. First, let's try to force restart your iPhone. To do this, press and quickly release the Volume Up button, then press and quickly release the Volume Down button, and then press and hold the Side button until the Apple logo appears.   After the restart, check if the issue is still present. If it is, we can try resetting your iPhone's settings. Go to Settings > General > Reset > Reset All Settings. This will not delete any of your data, but it will erase your iPhone's settings, such as your Wi-Fi passwords and wallpaper.  If the issue still persists, we can try restoring your iPhone to its factory settings. Have you backed up your iPhone recently?
#Person2#: Thank you for the troubleshooting steps. I just tried the force restart and the issue seems to have been resolved. I really appreciate your help.
#Person1#: You're welcome! I'm glad the issue has been resolved. Is there anything else I can help you with today?
#Person2#: No, that's all for now. Thank you so much for your help!
#Person1#: You're welcome! If you have any other issues in the future, don't hesitate to contact us again. Have a great day! Goodbye!

#Person1#: Hello! Welcome to [service|GadgetFix]. How may I assist you today?
#Person2#: Hi, I'm having some issues with my [device name|smartphone]. It keeps freezing and is very slow. I'm not sure what's causing it. Can you help me troubleshoot the issue?
#Person1#: Of course! Let's start by restarting your smartphone. This will help to clear out any temporary data that may be causing the issue. Once it has restarted, please let me know if the issue persists.
#Person2#: I've restarted my smartphone and the issue still persists. It's still freezing and running very slow.
#Person1#: I see. Are you receiving any error messages or codes? Also, may I know the model of your smartphone and what operating system it is running on?
#Person2#: No, I'm not receiving any error messages or codes. My smartphone is a [model|Samsung Galaxy S9] and it is running on [operating system|Android 10].
#Person1#: Thank you for that information. Let's try clearing the cache partition on your phone. This can help to remove any temporary files that might be causing the issue. Here are the steps:  1. Turn off your Samsung Galaxy S9. 2. Press and hold the Volume Up key and the Bixby key, then press and hold the Power key. 3. When the Samsung logo appears, continue to hold all three keys until the Android logo appears, then release all three keys. 4. Wait for the Android Recovery screen to appear. 5. Press the Volume down key until "Wipe cache partition" is highlighted. 6. Press the Power key to select. 7. Press the Volume down key to highlight "Yes" and press the Power key to select. 8. Wait for the cache partition to be cleared. 9. Press the Power key to select "Reboot system now."  Once your phone has restarted, please let me know if the issue persists.
#Person2#: I've followed the steps and cleared the cache partition, but unfortunately, the issue still persists. The phone is still running slow and freezing.
#Person1#: I'm sorry to hear that. It's possible that there may be an issue with the hardware or software of your phone. May I know if your phone is still under warranty?
#Person2#: Yes, my phone is still under warranty.
#Person1#: Great! Since your phone is still under warranty, I recommend that you take it to the nearest authorized Samsung service center for repair. They will be able to diagnose and fix the issue for you. Just bring your phone and your warranty documents with you to the service center.   Is there anything else I can help you with?
#Person2#: No, that's all. Thank you for your help!
#Person1#: You're welcome! I hope your phone gets fixed soon. If you have any other questions or concerns in the future, feel free to reach out to us again. Have a great day! Goodbye!

#Person1#: Great! Imagine there's a cube made of 27 smaller cubes, arranged in a 3x3x3 pattern. If you painted the three front-facing rows red, what would the cube look like if you sliced it horizontally at the midpoint of the cube (between the second and third rows)?
#Person2#: If we slice the cube horizontally at the midpoint between the second and third rows, we'll see the layers of cube faces that would be visible from the top.   The top layer would have the three red cubes in the front and six yellow cubes in the back.   The middle layer would have nine green cubes in the front and nine yellow cubes in the back.  The bottom layer would have nine blue cubes in the front and six yellow cubes in the back.   So, the top layer would be primarily made up of red and yellow cubes, the middle layer would have green, yellow and blue cubes, and the bottom layer would have blue and yellow cubes.
#Person1#: That's a good start! However, if we slice the cube horizontally at the midpoint between the second and third rows, we'll see the layers of cube faces that would be visible from the cut face with the color of the front-facing rows.   Let me give you a hint: since the front-facing rows are red, we only need to focus on the cube faces that are red. How many red-cube faces will be visible from the cut face?
#Person2#: Got it! Sorry about that.   If we slice the cube horizontally at the midpoint between the second and third rows, and look at the cut face, we will see the red cube faces of the three front-facing rows. Each row in the front has 3 red cubes. Since there are 3 rows of red cubes, there will be a total of 9 red cube faces visible from the cut face.
#Person1#: Yes, that's correct! So if we slice the cube horizontally at the midpoint between the second and third rows, and look at the cut face, we will see 9 red cube faces.   Great job figuring that out! Is there anything else you want me to explain or clarify about this puzzle?
#Person2#: No, that's all clear. Thank you for the great hint that helped me understand what to focus on!
#Person1#: You're welcome! It was my pleasure to assist you. If you have any other questions, just let me know. Otherwise, have a great day! Goodbye!

#Person1#: My grades are not bad, but not good enough. I know I didn't study at all this semester. Now I have to work very hard next semester to keep my scholarship.
#Person2#: I'll see you in the library, then.

#Person1#: To start with, may I know why you are interested in working for our company?
#Person2#: First, as far as I know, your company has had an impressive growth record. Second, I want to get into the foreign trade business.
#Person1#: Now you are with Quandong Company. What is your chief responsibility there?
#Person2#: I'm in charge of marketing activities in South-East Asia, for example, organizing trade conferences and arranging exhibitions.
#Person1#: Do you have any questions about the job?
#Person2#: Yes. Are the chances for employees to be transferred to overseas branches of the company?
#Person1#: Certainly. This is an international company, and ther're good chances for you to work overseas.
#Person2#: That would be good.

#Person1#: What do you want to do in this company after five years?
#Person2#: I want to be in a higher managerial position in the field of international marketing. I'm very interested in the European market hopefully, in Brussels.
#Person1#: Why do you think so?
#Person2#: It's truly exciting to work in newly emerging unified market. Brussels will be center of the new market in the continent.
#Person1#: What are you looking for in your next job?
#Person2#: My experience in my last job showed that I have the talent to motivate people. It could be seen from the low absentee rate in my team. I want to continue that kind of contribution and to further develop this potential.
#Person1#: What is your career objective?
#Person2#: I want to apply my knowledge and experience to a challenging position and finally move on to management level.
#Person1#: What do you consider important when looking for a job?
#Person2#: I think the most important thing is the nature of the job. One should never do anything one is not interested in. To me, pleasant working conditions with co-operative staff are also important.

#Person1#: Hello Martin, long time no see. I heard you went to France to study, how was that?
#Person2#: I was only there for a year, then I took a year off to travel around Europe.
#Person1#: Where did you go?
#Person2#: I went to Switzerland first and then Germany in Austria. I was planning to end my trip in Italy, but it didn't work out.
#Person1#: Oh well, is it good to be back?
#Person2#: Of course, but I'm returning to France to finish my degree. It's a four-year program.
#Person1#: Oh, so you're just back to Beijing to visit your family?
#Person2#: Yeah, I'm here for another 2 months.
#Person1#: Any plans?
#Person2#: In July, my mother is turning 70, so we'll do something special for her. Next month we're going to drive to the coast, then I will be back to France before September first.
#Person1#: Good for you, do you think you could fit me into your busy schedule?
#Person2#: Ha, I can always make time for my friends, how about tonight?
#Person1#: Deal.

#Person1#: How many laguages can you speak? 
#Person2#: I can speak French and German. 
#Person1#: How well can you speak them? 
#Person2#: I can speak German quite well, but I can't speak French very well. 
#Person1#: Can you help me to translate these sentences into German now? 
#Person2#: No, but I'll be able to tomorrow.

#Person1#: Hey, stop. [What?] And give me your money.
#Person2#: What? No, no. Listen here.
#Person1#: No, you listen. Hand over your purse, and I won't hurt you.
#Person2#: You've got to be joking.

#Person2#: Okay. Listen. Obviously, you haven't thought this through. I mean, who's going to rob someone as they walk out of a karate studio? Really?

#Person2#: Listen, mister. I'm telling you to back off. I'm a fifth-degree black belt, and I've trained for 25 years. I don't want to hurt you, but I'll defend myself if I have to.
#Person1#: Alright, baby. Let me have it.
#Person2#: You'd better call 911 first.
#Person1#: Right. [Punches and kicks and yells and screams ... ] Ahh, oh, man. Ooohhhh. That hurts.
#Person2#: Yeah. Listen. Here's your two dollars. You'll need them to cover your medical bills.

#Person1#: How are you, Missus Brandon?
#Person2#: Pretty good. How are you doing?
#Person1#: Not so good, I lost my job today.
#Person2#: I'm sorry to hear that.
#Person1#: How are your students doing?

#Person1#: I remember you gave our class a hard final test in my first year of college, many of us failed, but I really learned a lot from you. You see I can speak very good English.

#Person1#: Hello, how can I assist you today?
#Person2#: Hi, I am interested in seeking legal advice regarding a [case type|child custody] matter. Can you please let me know what information and documents you would need from me to proceed with the consultation?
#Person1#: Certainly, I can help you with that. To proceed with the consultation, I would need some basic information about your case, such as the names and ages of the children involved, the current custody arrangement, and any relevant court orders or agreements. Additionally, any evidence or documentation that supports your case, such as emails, text messages, or witness statements, would be helpful. If you have any specific questions or concerns, please feel free to let me know.
#Person2#: Thank you for your prompt response. I have two children, aged 6 and 8, and I am currently going through a divorce with my spouse. We have not yet reached a custody agreement, and I am concerned about my spouse's ability to provide a safe and stable environment for our children. I have some text messages and emails that I believe support my case, and I would like to discuss my options for pursuing custody. Can you please let me know what the fees for your services are and how long the case duration might be?
#Person1#: I understand your concerns and I am here to help you. Regarding the fees, it depends on the complexity of the case and the amount of time and resources required to resolve it. We offer a free initial consultation, during which we can discuss your case in more detail and provide you with a better estimate of the fees involved. As for the case duration, it also depends on the specific circumstances of your case, such as the court's schedule and the willingness of your spouse to cooperate. However, we will do our best to resolve your case as efficiently and effectively as possible.
#Person2#: Thank you for the information. That sounds reasonable. Can you please let me know when we can schedule the initial consultation?
#Person1#: Of course, I would be happy to schedule an initial consultation for you. We have availability [consultation date|next week] if that works for you. Please let me know what time works best for you and I will schedule the appointment accordingly.
#Person2#: Thank you for the prompt response. [consultation date|Next week] works for me. Can we schedule the consultation for [consultation time|2:00 pm] on that day?
#Person1#: Certainly, I have scheduled the consultation for [consultation date|next week] at [consultation time|2:00 pm]. Please let me know if there are any changes or if you need to reschedule. Also, please make sure to bring any relevant documents or evidence to the consultation so that we can discuss your case in more detail.
#Person2#: Thank you for scheduling the consultation for me. I will make sure to bring all the relevant documents and evidence to the meeting. If there are any changes or if I need to reschedule, I will let you know as soon as possible. Thank you for your time and assistance.
#Person1#: You're welcome. I look forward to meeting with you and discussing your case in more detail. If you have any further questions or concerns before the consultation, please don't hesitate to reach out to me. Goodbye!

#Person1#: Good morning. I'd like to join the school volunteer project, but I'm not sure what I should do.

#Person2#: Yes, are you Mr. James?

#Person1#: Yes, it is. I usually travel light.

#Person2#: Well, let me see. . . Do you work at IBM Corporation?
#Person1#: Yes, I do.
#Person2#: Now I remember. We met at a conference in Tokyo last year.

#Person1#: Great! Here it is: A farmer has 17 sheep and all but 9 die. How many sheep are left?
#Person2#: If all but 9 sheep die, it means that 17 - 9 = 8 sheep have died. Therefore, the number of sheep left is 9.
#Person1#: That's correct! Good job. Do you want to try another one? Here's a harder one: A man is pushing his car along a road when he comes to a hotel. He shouts, "I'm bankrupt!" Why did he do that?
#Person2#: Thank you! For the second question, the man might have shouted "I'm bankrupt!" because he was playing a game of Monopoly. In the game, if a player can't afford to pay rent on a property, they are declared bankrupt and lose the game.
#Person1#: That's a good guess, but that's not the answer I was looking for. Here's a hint: The answer has to do with the man's profession.
#Person2#: Thank you for the hint! Based on the hint, I would guess that the man is a car dealer and he was pushing his car to the hotel to sell it. However, when he arrived at the hotel, he realized that the hotel was closed or that the hotel was not interested in buying his car, leaving him with no way to sell the car and make money, hence he shouted "I'm bankrupt!" as he had no other means of making money.
#Person1#: That's a creative answer, but it's not the one I was thinking of. Here's another hint: The man's profession is not related to cars or hotels.
#Person2#: Thank you for the additional hint! Based on the new information, I would guess that the man is a gambler and he lost all his money at the hotel's casino. As a result, he shouted "I'm bankrupt!" because he had no more money left to gamble with or pay his debts.
#Person1#: Great job! That's the correct answer. The man was a gambler who lost all his money at the hotel's casino, leaving him with no money and no means to continue gambling. Therefore, he shouted "I'm bankrupt!" to express his financial situation. You have excellent inductive reasoning skills!
#Person2#: Thank you! I'm glad I was able to use my inductive reasoning skills to arrive at the correct answer. It was a fun challenge!
#Person1#: I'm glad you enjoyed it! It was great to see your analytical skills in action. If you have any more questions, feel free to ask. Otherwise, have a great day! Goodbye!

#Person1#: I was almost fooled by a telephone call yesterday.
#Person2#: What's it about?
#Person1#: A week's vacation for two. But I realized it was a cheat when they told me to ring a special telephone number to claim the price.
#Person2#: Well,those calls are charged at unbelievably high rates.

#Person1#: why are there still so many people overweight despite the current fitness craze?
#Person2#: well, there are certain factors that effect people's size and weight.
#Person1#: what are they?
#Person2#: one study said that low-income groups have a higher percentage of over-weight people than higher income families.
#Person1#: why?
#Person2#: the survey said that the low, income groups eat more junk food on a daily basis.
#Person1#: that makes sense. Probably less time to make dinner and the junk food is cheaper.
#Person2#: and junk food contains lots of fat and oil. There is one final reason why so many people are fat.
#Person1#: what's that?
#Person2#: nobody exercises anymore-not even kids! The average american home has the TV on for 6 hours a day!
#Person1#: wow! No wonder people are so fat. Say, Carl, looks like you could be doing a bit more exercising.
#Person2#: yeah, I guess so.
#Person1#: you should consider eating healthier food and getting some more exercise.
#Person2#: hey, I started a diet and lost 10 pounds.
#Person1#: so what happened?
#Person2#: well, I quit and gained it back plus 5 pounds.
#Person1#: you should have kept trying.

#Person1#: Hey, Mike, you're back. How was your summer camping?
#Person2#: Life in the great outdoors isn't exactly what I expected.
#Person1#: What did you do everyday?
#Person2#: First, everyone had to get up at 5:30 AM. Next, we had to make our beds before our camp adviser came to inspect the place. Then we had breakfast around 6:30 AM. After that, we had some free time, so I'd go down to the nearby stream to fish for a couple of hours. But yesterday, the only thing I caught was an old shoe and a tree branch. Then I slipped and fell in the stream and lost my fishing pole. In the afternoon, there were different activities we could choose from like swimming, horseback riding, and hiking.
#Person1#: What did you do at night?
#Person2#: At night, we sat around the campfire, sang songs and told ghost stories.
#Person1#: Well, a lot of activities going on there. You must have had a good time.
#Person2#: Oh no. I've learned that camping is just not for me.

#Person1#: Another 40 minutes, we can have lunch at the top or down by the water.

#Person1#: Our supervisor Lester does. Actually, Lester is kind of like the kitchen god.
