#Person1#: Hello, welcome to TechHelp. How may I assist you today?
#Person2#: Hi, I'm having some trouble with my [device name|printer]. It's not printing anything and I'm not sure what the issue is. Can you help me troubleshoot it?
#Person1#: Of course, I'd be happy to help you with that. Let's start by checking a few things. Is the printer turned on and connected to your computer?
#Person2#: Yes, the printer is turned on and connected to my computer. I've also checked the cables and they seem to be properly connected.
#Person1#: Great, let's try a few more things. First, let's check if there are any error messages on the printer's display panel. Can you please check and let me know if there are any error messages?
#Person2#: I don't see any error messages on the printer's display panel. It just shows that it's ready to print.
#Person1#: Okay, let's try printing a test page to see if the printer is working properly. To do this, please follow these steps:  1. Click on the Windows Start button and select "Settings". 2. Click on "Devices". 3. Click on "Printers & scanners". 4. Select your printer from the list of available printers. 5. Click on "Manage". 6. Click on "Print a test page".  Let me know if the test page prints successfully or if you encounter any error messages.
#Person2#: I followed the steps you provided and tried to print a test page, but it didn't print anything. There were no error messages either.
#Person1#: I see. In that case, let's try a few more troubleshooting steps.   1. First, let's check if the printer is set as the default printer. To do this, go to "Printers & scanners" in the Windows Settings and check if your printer is listed as the default printer. If not, select your printer and click on "Set as default".  2. Next, let's try restarting the printer and your computer. Turn off the printer, unplug it from the power source, wait for 30 seconds, and then plug it back in and turn it on. Then, restart your computer.  3. If the issue persists, try uninstalling and reinstalling the printer driver. To do this, go to "Printers & scanners" in the Windows Settings, select your printer, click on "Remove device", and then follow the prompts to uninstall the printer driver. Once the driver is uninstalled, restart your computer and then reinstall the printer driver from the manufacturer's website.  Let me know if any of these steps help resolve the issue.
#Person2#: Thank you for the troubleshooting steps. I followed all the steps you provided, but unfortunately, the printer still isn't printing anything. Is there anything else we can try?
#Person1#: I'm sorry to hear that the issue persists. One more thing we can try is to clear the print spooler. Sometimes, print jobs can get stuck in the print spooler and prevent new print jobs from being processed. Here's how you can clear the print spooler:  1. Press the Windows key + R to open the Run dialog box. 2. Type "services.msc" and press Enter. 3. Scroll down and find the "Print Spooler" service. 4. Right-click on the "Print Spooler" service and select "Stop". 5. Open File Explorer and navigate to C:\Windows\System32\spool\PRINTERS. 6. Delete all the files in the PRINTERS folder. 7. Go back to the Services window and right-click on the "Print Spooler" service again. 8. Select "Start" to restart the service.  After completing these steps, try printing a test page again and let me know if it works.
#Person2#: Thank you for the additional troubleshooting steps. I followed all the steps you provided and cleared the print spooler, but unfortunately, the printer still isn't printing anything. Is there anything else we can try?
#Person1#: I'm sorry to hear that the issue persists. At this point, it's possible that there may be a hardware issue with the printer. If the printer is still under warranty, I would recommend contacting the manufacturer's support team to see if they can assist you with repairing or replacing the printer. If the printer is not under warranty, you may need to take it to a repair shop to have it looked at.  Is there anything else I can assist you with?
#Person2#: No, that's all for now. Thank you for your help and suggestions. I'll contact the manufacturer's support team to see if they can assist me further.
#Person1#: You're welcome. I'm sorry we couldn't resolve the issue, but I hope the manufacturer's support team can assist you further. If you have any other questions or issues in the future, don't hesitate to contact us again. Have a great day! Goodbye.

#Person1#: Really? I got mine from her this morning.
#Person2#: I'm guessing that she's going to give me my invite today or tomorrow.
#Person1#: You're probably right, do you intend on going to the party?
#Person2#: I want to. I heard it's going to be really fun.
#Person1#: I know, it does sound pretty awesome.
#Person2#: Well, when does the party start?
#Person1#: It's supposed to start at about eight.
#Person2#: How many invitations has she given out?
#Person1#: I really don't know, but I don't think she gave out that many yet.
#Person2#: I really want to go, so I hope that she gives me my invite soon.

#Person1#: So you are green with envy at your neighbor? 
#Person2#: Well, he's really lucky. It seems that he could win the bet at every turn. 
#Person1#: But I don't envy those who are filthy with dough. That's not the whole life. 
#Person2#: I know what you mean. I'm not only after bucks. There's something more in life.

#Person1#: Hello! Is your taxi engaged?
#Person2#: No, this taxi is free.
#Person1#: Please take me to the Honging Hotel.
#Person2#: OK. Please get in. I'm glad to serve you.
#Person1#: Could you get there in twenty minutes?
#Person2#: It will take half an hour to get to the hotel.
#Person1#: I am in a hurry. Please take a shortcut. I have a friend waiting for me.
#Person2#: OK, I promise we'll get there in twenty minutes.
#Person1#: Thanks.

#Person1#: Have you had any experience with sales work?
#Person2#: Yes, I have. In fact, I had worked for a foreign trade company for nearly two years, where I established business ties with several firms.
#Person1#: What exactly did you do at that company?
#Person2#: Visit customers, dispatch consignments and things like that.
#Person1#: Did you like your work?
#Person2#: Yes, I did.
#Person1#: But when and why did you leave the company?
#Person2#: I left it two months ago. I didn't think I could learn much there, and there were not many opportunities for self-development.
#Person1#: I see. Why did you choose our company?
#Person2#: I've been informed that there are many opportunities to develop myself in your company. Besides, I grew up in a city in the Northeast. I have lots of acquaintances in the region, which might help to push sales.

#Person1#: Have you ever been to the Hard Rock Cafe?
#Person2#: No. What is it?
#Person1#: It's a rock and roll themed restaurant, but some locations are also hotels. It's a chain so cities all over the world have them. There is one in San Francisco. I was thinking about checking it out. Would you like to join me?
#Person2#: Sure, that sounds fun.
#Person1#: The original cafe was founded in London in 1971. But since 2007, the headquarters has been in Florida. It didn't start to expand worldwide until 1982 and the one San Francisco opened in 1984.
#Person2#: Interesting. Actually come to think of it, I think I passed by one when I was traveling in is Stumble Turkey. Wow, I guess they really are all over the world.
#Person1#: Yes, it's a very international chain. I was reading about it and apparently there are 191 locations all over the world in 59 different countries.
#Person2#: Wow, that's amazing.
#Person1#: Maybe we can go this weekend.
#Person2#: I'm working this weekend, but I get my schedule for the following week tomorrow. I should probably have a few days free next week.
#Person1#: OK. Sounds good. I'll call and see if I can make a reservation. Just give me a call when you know your schedule.

#Person1#: May I take this book out? I need it work on my paper for Dr. Smith's history class.
#Person2#: I'm afraid not. The book has been put on reserve by Dr. Smith. Unless you have his written permission, we won't lend it out.

#Person1#: Are we leaving on Saturday or Sunday?
#Person2#: We are leaving on Saturday. The plane leaves at midnight, so we're flying over night.
#Person1#: Oh, really? I'm not sure I can sleep on the plane. It makes me nervous.
#Person2#: You will be fine. It's easier to sleep than you might think.
#Person1#: OK, well, what time should we get to the airport?
#Person2#: I think 10:00 pm will give us enough time. We'll arrive in Thailand at 11:00 pm, their time. And Jenny is picking us up and taking us to the hotel.
#Person1#: Will aunt Blanca and cousin Matty be there?
#Person2#: Aunt Bianca will, but cousin Mattie is flying in the next day. Once she arrives, we'll take the train from Bangkok to Chiangmai. Then grandma Sammy is meeting us and we'll take a boat to pick at.
#Person1#: I'm really excited about this trip. It's going to be so much fun.
#Person2#: I'm excited too. I hope it's not too tiring with the family.

#Person1#: How can I help you today?

#Person1#: Let's sit here and order some coffee while I'll show you some pictures.

#Person2#: Where did you take this picture?
#Person1#: That's a picture of us taken when we went to the beach during vacation~

#Person1#: I'm worried about Monday's exam.

#Person2#: You are not allowed to use them. I think.

#Person2#: I'm afraid that's impossible. Teachers would not allow that to happen.

#Person1#: Glad to see you in your company.

#Person1#: May I help you?

#Person1#: May I help you?

#Person1#: Wake up, Erik, time to rise and shine.

#Person1#: You and everyone else. It looks more like a camp-ground than a library. 
#Person2#: Well, the dorm's too noisy to study in, and I guess this place is too quiet. 
#Person1#: Have you had any luck finding a topic for your paper? 
#Person2#: No. Prof. Grant told us to write about anything in cultural anthropology. For once I wish she hadn't given us so much of a choice. 
#Person1#: Well, why not write about the ancient civilizations of Mexico. You seem to be interested in that part of the world. I am, but there is too much material to cover. I'll be writing forever, and Grant only wants five to seven pages. 
#Person2#: So they limit it to one region of Mexico. Say the Yucatan. You've been there and you said it's got lots of interesting relics. 
#Person1#: That's not a bad idea. I brought many plenty of books and things back with me last summer. That would be great resource material. Now if I can only remember where I put them.

#Person1#: Great! Here's my question: I have a sequence of numbers - 1, 3, 5, 7, 9, 11. What's the next number in the sequence and why?
#Person2#: The next number in the sequence could be 13. This is because the sequence consists of odd numbers, with each number being 2 more than the previous number. So, the next number in the sequence would be 11 + 2 = 13. However, it's worth noting that there could be other patterns or rules that could apply to this sequence, so this is just one possible answer.
#Person1#: Correct! The next number in the sequence is 13, which is obtained by adding 2 to the previous number. Well done!
#Person2#: Thank you! Is there anything else I can help you with?
#Person1#: Actually, I have another question for you. Can you tell me what the next number is in this sequence: 1, 2, 4, 7, 11, 16, ___ ?
#Person2#: The sequence seems to be increasing at an accelerating rate. The difference between the first two terms is 1, between the second and third terms is 2, between the third and fourth terms is 3, and so on. Therefore, the difference between the sixth and seventh terms should be 6. So, adding 6 to the last term (16), we get 22. Thus, the next number in the sequence is 22.
#Person1#: Great job! You are correct, the next number in the sequence is 22. The sequence is formed by starting with 1, adding 1 to get the second term, then adding 2 to get the third term, then adding 3 to get the fourth term, and so on, with each term adding one more than the previous term. Well done!
#Person2#: Thank you! I'm glad that I was able to help you. Do you have any other questions?
#Person1#: No, that's all for now. Thank you for your help with the questions. Goodbye!

#Person1#: Great! Here's a question for you: Given an array of integers, find the maximum product of any three integers. Can you explain how you would solve this problem?
#Person2#: Sure! To solve this problem, we need to find the three largest integers in the array and multiply them together to get the maximum product. However, we need to be careful because there might be negative integers in the array that could potentially be a part of the maximum product. One way to handle this is to find the two smallest negative integers and the largest positive integer, and compare their product with the product of the three largest positive integers. The maximum of these two products will be the maximum product of any three integers in the array.   Here's a step-by-step algorithm that implements this logic:  1. Sort the array in non-decreasing order. 2. Check if the product of the last three integers in the sorted array is greater than the product of the first two and the last integer (which would be the maximum if there are no negative integers in the array). 3. If step 2 is true, return the product of the last three integers. 4. Otherwise, return the product of the last integer and the two smallest negative integers.
#Person1#: Nice job! Your algorithm is correct. However, for step 4, we need to consider a case where there might be no negative integers present in the array. So, to improve the algorithm, we can add an additional step which checks if there are any negative integers in the array or not. If there are no negative integers in the array, then we can return the product of the last three integers. If there are negative integers, then we can follow step 4 as it is.   Also, we can further optimize the algorithm by not sorting the entire array, but instead, finding the three largest and two smallest integers in one iteration and then calculating their products to return the result.  Let me know if you have any questions!
#Person2#: Thank you for pointing that out! You are correct, we need to handle the case when there are no negative integers present in the array.  And I agree, we can optimize the algorithm by not sorting the entire array. Here's an updated version of the algorithm:  1. Initialize the three largest integers (max1, max2, max3) to negative infinity and the two smallest integers (min1, min2) to positive infinity. 2. Loop through the array:    a. If the current element is greater than max1, max2, and max3 respectively, update max1, max2, and max3 accordingly.    b. If the current element is smaller than min1 and min2 respectively, update min1 and min2 accordingly. 3. If the product of the last three integers (max1, max2, and max3) is greater than the product of the last integer and the two smallest integers (min1 and min2) or if there are no negative integers in the array, return the product of max1, max2, and max3. 4. Otherwise, return the product of max1, min1, and min2.  I hope this updated algorithm addresses the issues and is more efficient.
#Person1#: Yes, your updated algorithm looks great! It handles all the edge cases and is more efficient than the previous one. Good job!  One more thing I want to mention is about the time complexity of this algorithm. The time complexity of this algorithm is O(n), where n is the length of the array. This is because we are only iterating through the array once to find the three largest and two smallest integers.  Overall, your algorithmic thinking is excellent! Do you have any more questions or is there anything else you want me to clarify?
#Person2#: Thank you for your kind words and for pointing out the time complexity of the algorithm. I don't have any more questions on this problem. I think I have a good understanding of the task and how to approach it. Thank you for your help!
#Person1#: You're welcome! I'm glad I could help. If you have any other questions or need help with anything else, feel free to reach out. Good luck with your algorithmic problem-solving!   Goodbye!

#Person1#: Why would you keep it?
#Person2#: I would keep it because you would be breaking our contract.
#Person1#: I get it now.
#Person2#: I hope that I cleared things up for you.

#Person1#: Well, what do you think is the reason most people do so badly at reaching goals?
#Person2#: They lose focus. Everybody's life is busy. There is so much happening in everybody's life. That what happens is they might have a goal and then something will get in the way of that. Maybe their goal is that they want to go on a holiday every year and they put in their leave form with their boss and their boss may ask them to wait for another month and then for another month. That is, so different things get in their way and people don't stand up for their goals. They don't struggle for them. They let other forces push them around a little bit. Also, a lot of people don't set goals; they think they do. But it's either a dream of very loose goal. So when they have to make a decision about a necessary action in their life the goal is so far back in their mind that they don't act in its best interest. Also because people will sit down and say 'oh, here are my goals' and forget all about them. Revisiting them every week is a good way. They stay at the top of your mind so you can take actions based on them.

#Person1#: When in Rome, do as the Romans do, they say.
#Person2#: What do the Romans do?
#Person1#: They live in Rome, of course, and go to work by car or bus. But sometimes it takes too long that way because of the traffic jams, so they walk.
#Person2#: In other words, the Romans do what everyone else does.
#Person1#: Yes, but they do it differently. Everything is different.
#Person2#: What do you mean?
#Person1#: Well, the climate is different for a start. It doesn't rain so much as it does in England. The sun shines more often.
#Person2#: I envy them for the sun.
#Person1#: I Know. You hate the rain, don't you?
#Person2#: I certainly do.
#Person1#: And a Roman really loves life. They always eat spaghetti and drink wine.
#Person2#: Not always, but they like a good meal. Lots of tourists go to Rome just for food.
#Person1#: Sure.

#Person2#: Indeed, the librarians are kind to me, they know much more about books than I expected. While working with them, they often recommend some books to me, they have opened a new world for me. I have never read so much in my life before. Now, I am eager for the thoughts of some of the world's best writers all the time.

#Person1#: Great! Here's the question: What do these words have in common: banana, dresser, grammar, potato, revive, uneven, assess?
#Person2#: These words have something in common, and that is that each word, when spelled backward, creates a new word or phrase that is also spelled correctly. For example, "banana" spelled backward is "ananab," which is not a real word, but it is spelled correctly. Similarly, "dresser" spelled backward is "resserd," which is also spelled correctly. The same goes for "grammar" spelled backward as "rammarg," "potato" spelled backward as "otatop," "revive" spelled backward as "eviver," "uneven" spelled backward as "nevenu," and "assess" spelled backward as "ssessa."
#Person1#: Great job! That's correct. Do you know any other words that have this property?
#Person2#: Yes, there are many other words that have this property. Here are some examples:   - Deified - Civic - Level - Madam - Racecar - Rotator - Refer - Repaper - Solos - Stats  There are many more words that have this property, but these are some of the most commonly known ones.
#Person1#: Excellent! You are correct. It's great to see that you know many words with this property. Keep up the good work!
#Person2#: Thank you! I'm always happy to help with any questions you may have.
#Person1#: I appreciate that. Thank you very much! That's all for now. Goodbye!

#Person1#: China is now a member of world trade organization. As a member of TO, China will have to make some changes in its economic policies so that it can follow the routines practiced by other TO members. Is it fair to China, do you think?
#Person2#: It's a hard question, but I'm sure the reexamination of China's economic policies in the past may lead us to a right answer to the question. After the establishment of new China, our government employed numerous economics policies to stimulate the growth of China's economy. These policies, however, favored our domestic enterprises and protected them from international competition and these policies have contributed a lot to the rapid growth of both China economy and our domestic enterprises. After China's entry into TO, Chinese domestic enterprises will have to compete with their foreign counterparts. This new situation entails some changes of Chinese economic policies. These changes will spur Chinese enterprises to strengthen their competitiveness in the long run.
#Person1#: We can infer that the non-discrimination principle is one of the most important principles of TO agreement. This principle requires equal treatment of domestic and foreign enterprise. Does the principle also apply to domestic enterprise of different ownerships?
#Person2#: Yes, it does. Domestic enterprises of different ownerships enjoy equal rights for the non-discrimination principle grants equal rights to enterprises, regardless of their nationality and ownership. I have found that although changes of China's economic policies are numerous, these changes are largely based on the most important economic principle ot TO agreement-non-discrimination principle. Such an understanding of principle of the changes may help us not only to have a good insight into the changes but also to foresee the tendency of the new changes of China's economic policies.

#Person1#: Morrie, what is an AHT?
#Person2#: Well, AHT stands for animal health technician. I graduated from California's first AHT class at Pures College. Some of us may work in the countryside, taking care of cattle, horses or sheep. Some may work in research labs. But most of us work in pet hospitals.

#Person2#: We run blood and other tests, give shots and prepare medicine. We also cut nails, clean teeth, give bath and clean the cages. We help keep the clinic running smoothly, making sure there is enough medicine and equipment.

#Person1#: Hello, thank you for contacting [service|TechHelp]. How may I assist you today?
#Person2#: Hi, I'm having some trouble with my [device name|printer]. It's not printing anything and I'm not sure why. Can you help me troubleshoot the issue?
#Person1#: Of course, I'd be happy to help you with that. Can you tell me a bit more about the issue you are experiencing with your [device name|printer]? Have you encountered any error messages or codes while trying to print?
#Person2#: No, I haven't seen any error messages or codes. The printer simply isn't responding when I try to print something. It's connected to my computer and the power is on, but it's not doing anything.
#Person1#: I understand. Here are a few troubleshooting steps you can try to get your [device name|printer] to print again:  1. Check the connection: Make sure your printer is properly connected to your computer and that the cables are securely plugged in. Also, check that your printer is turned on.  2. Restart the printer: Power off the printer and unplug it from the power source. Wait for a few seconds, then plug it back in and turn it on.  3. Check the printer queue: Sometimes a print job can get stuck in the queue, preventing other print jobs from being processed. To check the print queue, go to the Devices and Printers section on your computer, find your printer, and double-click it. This will open the printer queue. If there are any jobs listed there, try deleting them and then try printing again.  4. Update or reinstall the printer driver: If the printer driver is outdated or corrupted, it may prevent your printer from functioning properly. Go to the manufacturer's website and download the latest driver for your printer model. If you already have the latest driver, try uninstalling and reinstalling it.  Please try these steps and let me know if they solve the issue.
#Person2#: Thanks for the troubleshooting steps. I followed the first two steps and the printer still isn't working. When I checked the printer queue, there were no jobs listed. I'm not sure how to update or reinstall the printer driver - can you help me with that?
#Person1#: Sure, I can definitely help you with that. Can you tell me the make and model of your [device name|printer]? I can then guide you through the process of downloading and installing the latest driver.
#Person2#: Yes, the make and model of my printer is [printer make and model| HP Deskjet 3630].
#Person1#: Great, here's how you can update or reinstall the printer driver for your [printer make and model|HP Deskjet 3630]:  1. Go to the HP website and click on "Support" at the top of the page.  2. Enter your printer model ([printer make and model|HP Deskjet 3630]) in the search box and click on "Search".  3. Click on the "Software, Drivers and Firmware" tab and select your operating system.  4. Download the latest driver for your printer and save it to your computer.  5. Once the driver is downloaded, double-click the file to begin the installation process.  6. Follow the on-screen instructions to install the driver.  7. Once the driver is installed, restart your computer and try printing again.  Let me know if this helps resolve the issue.
#Person2#: Thank you for the detailed instructions. I just downloaded and installed the latest driver for my [printer make and model|HP Deskjet 3630]. I restarted my computer and tried printing again, but it's still not working. Any other suggestions?
#Person1#: I see. In that case, there are a few more things we can try:  1. Check ink cartridges: Make sure that you have enough ink in your printer. If the ink cartridges are low or empty, replace them with new ones and try printing again.  2. Check paper tray: Ensure that the paper tray is loaded with paper and that the papers are properly aligned. Sometimes, even a small misalignment of paper can cause issues with printing.  3. Clean printer head: Try cleaning the printer head to remove any dust or debris that may be blocking the ink nozzles. To do this, go to the printer settings on your computer, and look for the option to clean the printer head.  4. Reset the printer: Try resetting the printer to its default settings. To do this, go to the printer settings on your computer, and look for the option to reset the printer to factory default settings.  If none of these steps work, there may be a hardware issue with your [printer make and model|HP Deskjet 3630]. In that case, I suggest you contact the manufacturer's customer support for further assistance.
#Person2#: Thanks for the additional troubleshooting steps. I just checked the ink cartridges and they are full, and the paper tray is properly loaded. I also tried cleaning the printer head and resetting the printer, but it's still not working. I think you're right that there may be a hardware issue. I will contact the manufacturer's customer support for further assistance. Thank you for your help!
#Person1#: You're welcome! I'm sorry we weren't able to fully resolve the issue, but I'm glad I could assist you with troubleshooting. If you have any other questions or concerns in the future, don't hesitate to contact us again. Have a great day! Goodbye.

#Person1#: Great! Here's the question: Given a list of integers, write a function that returns the two highest integers in the list. How would you approach this?
#Person2#: To solve this problem, here's a simple approach:  1. Initialize two variables with negative infinity. 2. Loop through the list of integers and update the two variables as follows:    - If the current integer is greater than the first variable, update the first variable to be the current integer.    - If the current integer is greater than the second variable but less than or equal to the first variable, update the second variable to be the current integer. 3. Return the two variables.  Here's what the code would look like in Python:  ``` def get_two_highest(numbers):     highest = second_highest = float('-inf')     for num in numbers:         if num > highest:             second_highest = highest             highest = num         elif num > second_highest:             second_highest = num     return highest, second_highest ```  Let me know if you have any questions!
#Person1#: Great approach! One thing to add is to handle the case if the input list is empty or contains less than two integers. We can raise a `ValueError` in such cases. Here is an updated implementation:  ``` def get_two_highest(numbers):     if len(numbers) < 2:         raise ValueError("Input list must contain at least two integers")     highest = second_highest = float('-inf')     for num in numbers:         if num > highest:             second_highest = highest             highest = num         elif num > second_highest:             second_highest = num     return highest, second_highest ```  Hope this helps!
#Person2#: Great suggestion! Handling the case of an empty list or a list with less than two integers is important to avoid unexpected behavior in the code. Thank you for the suggestion!
#Person1#: You're welcome! Is there anything else you'd like to know about this topic?
#Person2#: No, I think that covers this topic for now. Thank you for the question!
#Person1#: You're welcome! Feel free to reach out if you have any other questions or topics you'd like to discuss in the future. Goodbye!

#Person1#: What arrangement will you make about payment?

#Person2#: But such terms are quite common in the machinery trade. Other suppliers are offering better terms. Some even allow payment 60days after sight.
#Person1#: We ask for full payment at sight, because we guarantee 90 % mechanical efficiency for all our products. You don't have the same guarantee from other suppliers. The usual percentage is around 85.
#Person2#: That's true. I'm eager to know if you could send some fitters to ensure good operation.
#Person1#: Yes. We usually send technicians abroad to offer after-sales service to our customers.
#Person2#: If you send fitters along with the machines to ensure that all the machines run properly, and if you provide after-sales service, we agree to make the payment in full.
#Person1#: Thank you. I am glad we have come to an agreement at last.

#Person1#: Well, I'm glad you're finally back. I was wondering what happened.

#Person1#: How about 15 % the first six months and the second six months at 12 % with a guarantee of 3000 units?

#Person1#: Good. Let's iron out the remaining details. When do you want to take delivery?
#Person2#: We'd like you to execute the first order by the 31 st.

#Person1#: Fine. But I'd prefer the first shipment to be 1000 units, the next 2000. The 31 st is quite soon, I can't guarantee 1500.
#Person2#: I can agree to that. Well, if there's nothing else, I think we've settled everything.

#Person1#: Do you wear a seatbelt every time you drive or ride in a car?
#Person2#: Do I have to? I'm a great driver with fifteen years of driving experience.
#Person1#: The chances of being injured in a car accident this year are one in seventy-five. I think that's worth thinking about seriously.
#Person2#: I've never had a serious accident.
#Person1#: My brother was not as lucky as you. Last December, he was almost killed in an accident. He wasn't wearing a seatbelt.
#Person2#: Wow, that's terrible.
#Person1#: Fastening your seatbelt should be an automatic thing as soon as you get into your car. But too many people still refuse to wear seatbelts.
#Person2#: OK, I get the message. From now on, I'll wear my seatbelt.

#Person1#: Helen, how do you like your new apartment?
#Person2#: Well, I wish I had moved in, the man who lives upstairs often plays the piano till midnight. I really cannot stand it.
#Person1#: Why don't you ask him to stop?
#Person2#: I've tried, but it doesn't work, he never listens to me. What's worse, he isn't the only one that I cannot stand. The woman who lives next to me often comes over to borrow things, but she seldom returns anything.
#Person1#: Then, don't lend her anything.
#Person2#: Now I don't even open the door when she knocks, but it makes me uncomfortable. I'm afraid I'll have to move again.
#Person1#: You can move in with my sister Susan. The girl Jennifer, who is sharing her apartment has moved out, so she has a free room now.
#Person2#: That's great, your sister is such a good girl. Everyone likes her. I'll call her and move as soon as possible. After all, I need to sleep well at night, in order to do well in the coming exam.

#Person1#: Joanne, let's not make this divorce any more acrimonious than it already is, okay? Let's just get down to business and start dividing this stuff up fairly, so we can go our separate ways, alright?
#Person2#: Fine with me. I just want to get this over with. It's important we make a clean break. I should have signed a pre-nup.
#Person1#: What was that?
#Person2#: Nothing! Anyway, you're right, there's no reason this has to be nasty. My lawyer tells me you'Ve accepted our alimony proposal and the division of property, as well as the custody agreement-I keep the cat and you get the dog. So that's done. . . finally.
#Person1#: Let's not go there, Joanne! Ok, so let's start with the record collection, I'll take the albums I contributed and you can have your cheesy disco albums back.
#Person2#: Fine, but I'm keeping the antique gramophone as my grandfather gave it to me.
#Person1#: I believe that was a wedding present to both of us, Joanne. And you hardly ever use it!
#Person2#: He's my grandfather, and he never really liked you anyway!
#Person1#: Whatever! Alright, I'll concede the silly gramophone, if you'll agree that I get the silver tea set.
#Person2#: How typical, when are you ever going to use a silver tea set? Fine! I don't want to drag this out any longer than necessary. What's next? What about these old photographs?
#Person1#: Which ones? Let me have a look. Wow, look at that! That brings back memories. . . That?
#Person2#: Our trip to Italy! I remember that day. We were going to visit the Trev fountain, and we got caught in the rain. . .
#Person1#: . . . and you looked so adorable with your hair all wet. I had to take a picture of you standing there in that little alley, smiling and laughing in the rain. . .
#Person2#: Oh, we really did have fun back then, didn't we?
#Person1#: Oh, Joanne, are we making a big mistake? I know our relationship has been on the rocks for sometime but are you sure we can't reconcile and try again? I still love you.
#Person2#: Oh Jeff! I love you too! I'm so glad we didn't have to decide who keeps the motorcycle.
#Person1#: The motorcycle? But that's mine!

#Person1#: What do you think of the products at the furniture store downtown?

#Person1#: Great! Here's the question: A man is pushing his car along a road when he comes to a hotel. He shouts, "I'm bankrupt!" Why did he do that?
#Person2#: Hmm, this is an interesting puzzle. I'm not entirely sure, but I'll try to reason it out.   One possibility is that the man was playing a game of Monopoly, where players can go bankrupt if they run out of money. However, this doesn't seem very likely since he's pushing a car and not carrying a Monopoly board.  Another possibility is that the man is a chess player and he's playing a game of chess in his head. In chess, if a player is in a position where they cannot make any moves without being captured, they are said to be in checkmate and have lost the game. In a similar way, if the man is pushing his car and cannot afford to fix it, he may feel like he's in a position where he cannot make any moves without losing the game of life, so to speak.   However, these are just guesses. Do you have any hints or additional information that could help me solve this puzzle?
#Person1#: Your reasoning is quite good, but unfortunately, both of your guesses are incorrect. Here's a hint: the man is not bankrupt in the traditional sense of the word.
#Person2#: Thank you for the hint. That helps narrow down the possibilities.   Based on the new information, I'm going to take a different approach to solving this puzzle.   One possibility is that the man is playing a word game or a riddle. For example, the word "bankrupt" could be a clue to a hidden message or a pun.   Another possibility is that the man is trying to get someone's attention or make a statement. Perhaps he's trying to get the attention of someone inside the hotel or he's making a statement about his financial situation.   However, without more information, it's difficult to say for sure. Do you have any other hints or details that could help me solve this puzzle?
#Person1#: You're on the right track! Here's another hint: the man is not alone.
#Person2#: Thank you for the additional hint. That helps narrow down the possibilities even further.   Based on the new information, I'm going to guess that the man is pushing his car along the road with someone else inside the car. The person inside the car may be a friend or family member who is also in financial trouble.   When the man reaches the hotel, he shouts "I'm bankrupt!" to get the attention of someone inside the hotel who may be able to help them. The man may be hoping that someone inside the hotel will offer them a place to stay or some financial assistance.   However, this is still just a guess. Do you have any other hints or details that could help me solve this puzzle?
#Person1#: You're very close! The man is indeed pushing his car with someone else inside, but the person inside the car is not a friend or family member. Here's another hint: the man is pushing his car because he has no other choice.
#Person2#: Thank you for the additional hint. Based on the new information, I'm going to guess that the man is a taxi driver and the person inside the car is a passenger.   The man may have been driving the passenger to their destination when his car broke down. Since he has no other choice, he's pushing the car along the road with the passenger still inside.   When the man reaches the hotel, he shouts "I'm bankrupt!" to get the attention of someone inside the hotel who may be able to help him and his passenger. The man may be hoping that someone inside the hotel will offer them a place to stay or some financial assistance so that they can continue their journey.   However, this is still just a guess. Do you have any other hints or details that could help me solve this puzzle?
#Person1#: Congratulations! You got it right! The man is indeed a taxi driver and the passenger is still inside the car. The reason he shouted "I'm bankrupt!" is that he landed on a square in a game of Monopoly that says "Go to Jail. Go directly to Jail. Do not pass Go. Do not collect $200." Since he doesn't have $200 to pay the fine, he has to go to jail, which means he won't be able to work and earn money for a while.   So, he's shouting "I'm bankrupt!" to let his passenger know that he won't be able to continue the journey and that they'll have to find another way to get to their destination.   Well done! You solved the puzzle!
#Person2#: Thank you! That was a fun puzzle to solve. I'm glad I was able to figure it out in the end.
#Person1#: You're welcome! I'm glad you enjoyed it and were able to solve it. It was a pleasure to challenge your deductive reasoning skills. If you have any other puzzles or questions, feel free to ask. Otherwise, have a great day! Goodbye!

#Person1#: Are you doing anything special this weekend?

#Person1#: First of all, I would like to thank you for your kind invitation to visit your beautiful country. I hope my visit will help to promote a friendly relationship between us.
#Person2#: We've been looking forward to your visit. It is a great pleasure for us to have you as our guest. It is always more convenient to discuss things face to face.
#Person1#: I would like to tell you that my clients are very satisfied with the last delivery of your slippers. The styles and colors are very much to the taste of our market.
#Person2#: We've received some similar comments from other Australian firms too.
#Person1#: I understand you are selling the same products to some other Australian importers. This tends to complicate my business. As you know, I am experienced in the business of slippers and enjoy a good business relationship with all the leading whole - sabers and retailers in that line. I have a mind to expand this business in the years to come. One of the reasons of my visit here is to sign a sole agency agreement with you on these items for a period of 3 years. As it is to our mutual interests and profit, I am sure you'll have no objection to it.
#Person2#: We appreciate your good intention and your effort in pushing the sale of our slippers. As you know, the demand for this item in your market is quite substantial. However, according to our records, the total amount of your order last year was moderate, which does not warrant an agency appointment. Unless you increase the turnover we can hardly appoint you our sole agent.
#Person1#: I'll come to that. My proposal is
#Person2#: As far as I remember, we sold about 40, 000 pairs last year to you alone. Don't you think this annual turnover is rather conserve - time for a sole agent?

#Person2#: Let's put it this way. I propose a sole agency agreement for Ladies and gents plastic slippers ( excluding children's ) for a duration of 3 years ; 60, 000 pairs to be sold in the first year, 70, 000 pairs in the second year, and 80, 000 pairs in the third year, the area is to be within the continent of Australia ( excluding any neighboring island ), commission 5 %.
#Person1#: You certainly drive a hard bargain, Mrs. Brown.

And with the sole agency in your hand, there will be no competition and you can easily control the market, which would naturally result in bigger sales. I'm sure you can fulfill the agreement without much difficulty.
#Person1#: Well, if you put it this way, I'll have to comply. When shall we sign the contract, Mrs. Brown?

#Person1#: Tomorrow afternoon will be fine.

#Person1#: Great! Here's a question: Given an array of integers, find the maximum possible sum you can get by adding together some of the integers. The added integers should not be adjacent to each other in the array. Can you provide an algorithm for this?
#Person2#: Sure! Here's a possible algorithm:  1. Initialize two variables, `include` and `exclude`, to 0. 2. Iterate through the array of integers. For each integer:    - Calculate the new value of `exclude` as the maximum of `exclude` and `include`.    - Calculate the new value of `include` as the maximum of `include` and the previous value of `exclude` plus the current integer. 3. Return the maximum of `include` and `exclude`.  The idea behind this algorithm is to keep track of the maximum sum we can get if we include the current integer or exclude it. If we include the current integer, we cannot include the previous integer (because they are adjacent), so we use the value of `exclude` before the update. If we exclude the current integer, we can use either the previous value of `include` or `exclude`, whichever is larger. At the end, we return the maximum of the two possibilities.  I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any questions.
#Person1#: Great job! Your algorithm is correct. I have one follow-up question. What is the time complexity of this algorithm?
#Person2#: The time complexity of this algorithm is O(n), where n is the length of the input array. This is because we iterate through the array once and perform constant-time operations for each element. Therefore, the overall time complexity is linear in the size of the input, which is quite efficient.
#Person1#: That's correct! You have a good understanding of algorithmic complexity. I have one last question. Is there a way to optimize the algorithm further?
#Person2#: One way to optimize this algorithm further is by using constant space instead of keeping track of two variables. Instead of using `include` and `exclude`, we can use four variables `inc1`, `inc2`, `exc1`, and `exc2`, where `inc1` and `exc1` are the values calculated in the previous iteration, and `inc2` and `exc2` are the values calculated in the current iteration. We can update these variables as follows:  1. Initialize `inc1` and `exc1` to 0. 2. Iterate through the array of integers. For each integer:    - Set `exc2` to the maximum of `exc1` and `inc1`.    - Set `inc2` to the maximum of `inc1` and `exc1` plus the current integer.    - Set `inc1` and `exc1` to `inc2` and `exc2`, respectively. 3. Return the maximum of `inc2` and `exc2`.  This way, we can avoid using extra space for storing the previous values of `include` and `exclude`, and we can achieve the same result using only constant space.  I hope this helps! Let me know if you have
#Person1#: any follow-up questions.
#Person2#: That's a great optimization! By using four variables instead of two, we can avoid using extra space, which is definitely an improvement. Thanks for sharing this!  I don't have any more questions at the moment. Your explanation was clear and concise. Thanks for your help!
#Person1#: You're welcome! I'm glad I could help. If you have any more questions in the future, don't hesitate to ask. Goodbye!

#Person1#: Great! Here's my question: Imagine you have a cube made up of smaller cubes, with each side of the cube consisting of 5 smaller cubes. If you paint the outermost layer of cubes red, how many cubes will be painted red?
#Person2#: Sure, let me try to visualize this. So, we have a cube made up of smaller cubes, with each side of the cube consisting of 5 smaller cubes. That means the cube has 5x5x5 = 125 smaller cubes.   If we paint the outermost layer of cubes red, we need to find out how many cubes are on the outermost layer. Since each side of the cube consists of 5 smaller cubes, the outermost layer will consist of the 5x5 = 25 cubes on each face of the cube. There are 6 faces in total, so the total number of cubes on the outermost layer will be 6x25 = 150.  However, we have counted the 4 corner cubes on each face twice, so we need to subtract them from our total count. There are 4 corners on each face, and 6 faces in total, so we need to subtract 4x6 = 24 from our count.   Therefore, the total number of cubes that will be painted red is 150 - 24 = 126.
#Person1#: Great job! That is the correct answer. You have a good spatial reasoning ability.
#Person2#: Thank you! I'm glad I could help. Is there anything else I can assist you with?
#Person1#: No, that was all. Thank you for your help with the question. Goodbye!

#Person1#: Sure thing! Here's my question: Suppose you have a sequence of numbers - 1, 3, 6, 10, 15, ... - and you want to find a formula for the nth term of this sequence. What might be the formula?
#Person2#: This is a sequence of triangle numbers where each term is equal to the sum of all positive integers less than or equal to n.  The formula for the nth triangle number can be expressed as: n(n+1)/2  So, the formula for the nth term of the given sequence would be n(n+1)/2.
#Person1#: Great job, that's exactly right! You really know your stuff.
#Person2#: Thank you! Is there anything else I can help you with?
#Person1#: No, that's all for now. Thank you for your expert response, have a good day!
#Person2#: You're welcome! Have a great day too!
#Person1#: Goodbye!

#Person1#: So, Claire, you're into drama!
#Person2#: Yes, I have a master's degree in drama and theatre. At the moment, I'm hoping to get onto a Ph.D program.
#Person1#: What excites you about drama?
#Person2#: Well, I find it's a communicative way to study people and you learn how to read people in drama. So usually I can understand what people are saying even though they might be lying.
#Person1#: That would be useful.
#Person2#: Yeah, it's very useful for me as well. I'm an English lecturer, so I use a lot of drama in my classes such as role plays. And I ask my students to create mini-dramas. They really respond well. At the moment, I'm hoping to get onto a Ph.D course. I'd like to concentrate on Asian drama and try to bring Asian theatre to the world's attention. I don't know how successful I would be, but here's hoping.
#Person1#: Oh, I'm sure you'll be successful. Now, Claire, what do you do for stage fright?
#Person2#: Ah, stage fright! Well, many actors have that problem. I get stage fright every time I'm going to teach a new class. The night before, I usually can't sleep.
#Person1#: What? For teaching?
#Person2#: Yes. I get really bad stage fright. But the minute I step into the classroom or get onto the stage, it just all falls into place. Then I just feel like: Yeah, this is what I mean to do. And I'm fine.
#Person1#: Wow, that's cool!

#Person1#: My computer isn't running at the same speed it used to be, it is testing my patience everyday. Can you tell me how to make it run faster?
#Person2#: If you want to speed up your system, you'Ve got to clean it up first.
#Person1#: How?
#Person2#: You need to free your disk space. The simplest way is to use a Disk-Cleanup tool to remove temporary files and in store programs that you no longer use. Things should be fine next time you start. You also need to control what starts up. There is a program calls Start-up Delayer, It can help to set after how much time programs should be loaded after Windows boosts. For example, you can choose to set your Fox Mail program to load 30 seconds after Windows starts up.
#Person1#: Very useful advice, I will try them right now.

#Person1#: are you good at cooking? 
#Person2#: no, but I'm pretty good at eating!

#Person1#: if you haven't tried Beijing duck yet, I'd like to treat you to a meal at a famous duck restaurant near Qianmen. It would be a pity if you left without tasting it!

#Person1#: Hello, how can I assist you?
#Person2#: Hello, I am seeking legal advice regarding [case type|a criminal matter]. Can you please tell me how your law firm can assist me with this issue?
#Person1#: Of course, we would be happy to assist you with your [case type|criminal matter]. Our law firm has a team of experienced criminal lawyers who have handled a wide range of criminal cases, from minor charges to serious offenses. We can provide you with legal advice, represent you in court, and help you navigate the criminal justice system. Would you like to schedule a consultation to discuss your case in more detail?
#Person2#: Yes, that would be great. Can you please tell me more about the consultation process?
#Person1#: Sure, our consultation process usually begins with us gathering information about your case. During the consultation, one of our criminal lawyers will listen to your story, ask you some questions, and evaluate your case. We will then provide you with legal advice and let you know what your options are. If you decide to hire us, we will discuss our fees and the next steps in the process. The consultation can be done either in-person at our office or over the phone, whichever works best for you. Would you like to schedule a consultation with one of our criminal lawyers?
#Person2#: Yes, I would like to schedule a consultation. Can you please let me know what documents or information I should bring to the consultation?
#Person1#: Certainly. It would be helpful if you could bring any documents related to your [case type|criminal matter] to the consultation. This could include police reports, court documents, witness statements, or any other relevant information. Additionally, if you have any questions or concerns, it would be helpful to write them down so we can address them during the consultation. If you don't have any documents or information, don't worry, we can still discuss your case and provide you with legal advice. When would you like to schedule the consultation?
#Person2#: Thank you for the information. I will gather all the relevant documents and prepare a list of questions. Can we schedule the consultation for [consultation date|next week] at [consultation time|2 PM]? Also, can you please let me know what the fees for the consultation will be?
#Person1#: Certainly, I can schedule the consultation for [consultation date|next week] at [consultation time|2 PM]. The fee for the initial consultation is [fees|$150], which will be credited toward your legal fees if you decide to hire us. You can pay the consultation fee at the end of the consultation by credit card, check or cash. I will send you a confirmation email with the scheduled appointment and our office address. Please let me know if you have any further questions.
#Person2#: Thank you for the confirmation. I will be waiting for the email with the appointment and office address. I appreciate your time and assistance.
#Person1#: You're welcome. We look forward to meeting with you and helping you with your [case type|criminal matter]. If you have any further questions or concerns, feel free to reach out to us. We will send you the email shortly. Have a great day!
#Person2#: Thank you, you too!
#Person1#: Goodbye!

#Person1#: Amy. So, how are you doing?
#Person2#: Oh, hi Stuart. School is so crazy these days, and when I'm not at school, I'm at work.

#Person1#: Ah, come on. We're planning on having dinner around 6:30 and then seeing a movie at 7:30. We should be home by 10:30 ... 11:30 at the latest. I mean you're always saying that you don't have any friends ... and that your love life ... well, that you don't have one. Come on!
#Person2#: I ... I don't think I'd better. I haven't been feeling well lately.

#Person1#: Aunt Cindy, do you shop online often?
#Person2#: Yes. It's very convenient and the price is even lower.

#Person2#: You should open an account at the online bank first. After that, you can buy anything online.
#Person1#: Are there many things online?
#Person2#: Sure. You can find everything all over the world. Let's check it out online!
#Person1#: Oh, what's this? Second-hand cellphone store?
#Person2#: Yeah, this one is very famous with a good credit among on-line customers. It's like an open free market. If you want to change your cellphone for a new one, you can sell the old one here.
#Person1#: Really? How to do that?
#Person2#: Take some pictures of the thing you want to sell, then upload it onto line with a brief description about it and leave your connecting number. Then your stuff will be sold by auction.
#Person1#: That's amazing. I'd love to try it later. Oh, an on-line virtual supermarket?
#Person2#: Let's click to check it out.
#Person1#: Oh, I got it. It simulates the real supermarket, which makes it feel so real. Mom will love it. She loves shopping in supermarkets.
#Person2#: No doubt about it. Shopping online will get more and more popular. It's a real revolution about people's consuming habits.
#Person1#: Are there any disadvantages about it?
#Person2#: It takes some time for the stuff you buy online to arrive. But I think this problem will be solved soon.

#Person1#: Now we've given a CIF Shanghai price for some steel plates. What insurance rate do you suggest we should get?

#Person1#: Why not?
#Person2#: Because they aren't delicate goods and won't likely be damaged on the voyage. FPA will be good enough.
#Person1#: Then am I right in understanding that FPA doesn't cover partial loss for the nature of particular average.
#Person2#: That's right. On the other hand, a WA policy covers you against partial loss in all cases.
#Person1#: Are there any other clauses in marine policies?
#Person2#: Oh, lots of them. For instance, War Risks, TEND and SICC.
#Person1#: Well, thank you very much for all that information. Could you give me a quotation for my consignment now?
#Person2#: Are you going to make an offer today?
#Person1#: Yes. My customer is in urgent need of the steel plates.
#Person2#: Ok, I'll get this rate right away.
#Person1#: Thank you.

#Person1#: Great! Here's the question: What do these words have in common: banana, dresser, grammar, potato, revive, uneven?

#Person1#: Ah, I see. These words have something in common with the letters they contain. I think I got it. These words have letters that when spelled backward, they still spell the same word. These are called palindromes.
#Person2#: Yes, that's correct! These words are indeed palindromes. They read the same backward as forward. Well done!
#Person1#: Thank you! That was a great question. Do you have any other questions or is there anything else I can help you with?

#Person1#: You're welcome! It was my pleasure to help. Don't hesitate to reach out if you have any other questions in the future. Goodbye!

#Person1#: Great! Here's my question: Given an array of integers, how would you find the subarray with the largest sum?
#Person2#: The problem you are describing is known as the Maximum Subarray Problem. One way to solve it is by using Kadane's algorithm. This algorithm traverses the array and keeps track of the current maximum subarray ending at each position. The maximum subarray ending at position i is either the element at position i or the element at position i plus the maximum subarray ending at position i-1. The overall maximum subarray is the one with the largest sum of all the maximum subarrays ending at each position.   Here's some pseudocode for Kadane's algorithm: ``` max_ending_here = max_so_far = 0 for num in nums:     max_ending_here = max(num, max_ending_here + num)     max_so_far = max(max_so_far, max_ending_here) return max_so_far ```  This algorithm has a time complexity of O(n), where n is the length of the input array.
#Person1#: That's correct! Kadane's algorithm is a very efficient way to solve this problem. Can you think of any other algorithms that could be used to solve this problem?
#Person2#: Yes, there is another approach called Divide and Conquer that can be used to solve this problem.   The idea behind this approach is to divide the array into two halves and recursively find the maximum subarray sum in each half. Then, we combine these two values to get the maximum subarray sum that crosses the two halves. Finally, we take the maximum value among these three values to get the maximum subarray sum of the entire array.  Here's some pseudocode for the Divide and Conquer approach: ``` def max_subarray_sum(nums, left, right):     if left == right:         return nums[left]     mid = (left + right) // 2     left_sum = max_subarray_sum(nums, left, mid)     right_sum = max_subarray_sum(nums, mid+1, right)     cross_sum = max_crossing_subarray(nums, left, mid, right)     return max(left_sum, right_sum, cross_sum)  def max_crossing_subarray(nums, left, mid, right):     left_sum = float('-inf')     curr_sum = 0     for i in range(mid, left-1, -1):         curr_sum += nums[i]         left_sum = max(left_sum, curr
#Person1#: It seems like your pseudocode was cut off. Can you please provide the rest of it?
#Person2#: Oops, sorry about that! Here's the rest of the pseudocode for the Divide and Conquer approach:  ```     curr_sum = 0     right_sum = float('-inf')     for i in range(mid+1, right+1):         curr_sum += nums[i]         right_sum = max(right_sum, curr_sum)     return left_sum + right_sum ```  The `max_crossing_subarray` function finds the maximum subarray sum that crosses the midpoint of the array. It does this by starting at the midpoint and iterating towards the left and right ends of the array, keeping track of the maximum subarray sum seen so far on both sides. The overall maximum subarray sum that crosses the midpoint is the sum of the maximum subarray sum on the left side and the right side.  The `max_subarray_sum` function is the main function that recursively divides the array into two halves and combines the results to find the maximum subarray sum of the entire array.   The time complexity of this algorithm is O(n log n), where n is the length of the input array.
#Person1#: Great explanation! You are correct that the Divide and Conquer approach has a time complexity of O(n log n). It's good to know that there are different ways to solve this problem, and it's important to understand the pros and cons of each approach. Thanks for sharing your knowledge with me!  Goodbye!

#Person1#: Hey. Have you been watching any of the World Cup soccer matches?
#Person2#: Well, I was watching until my favorite team was bounced out of the first round of play. I mean, they should have made all the way to the second round, but a whole series of events cost the team the opportunity to prove themselves on the world stage.

#Person2#: Yea, but that's beside the point. And, and then, in the second game, the refs made some terrible calls, allowing the opposing team to slip by with a victory. I mean, we were robbed on that one. The refs must have been walking in their sleep!

#Person1#: Really?
#Person2#: And finally, our team was ahead in the final watch---I mean they were way out ahead until the other team rallied in the final three minutes of play to squeak out a victory. It was a total embarrassment for our team. Our team was booed. All I can say is that the sun must have been in our players' eyes ...
#Person1#: Uh, wasn't it a night game?
#Person2#: That's beside the point, too. You just not understanding anything I'm saying.

#Person2#: Ah, I can't watch any more soccer, so I've been following an online chess tournament.
#Person1#: What?! Now, that has to be the most ridiculous reaction I have ever heard of. So, you're going to completely boycott the rest of the play just because your team got bounced out of the tournament?
#Person2#: Ah, forget it. You just don't understand.

#Person1#: Hello! How can I assist you today?
#Person2#: Hi, I would like to schedule an appointment with a dermatologist, please.
#Person1#: Of course! We would love to help you with that. May I have your full name and date of birth, please?
#Person2#: Sure! My name is [patient name|John Doe] and my date of birth is [DOB|01/01/1990].
#Person1#: Thank you, John. Can you please let me know what your preferred date and time for the appointment are?
#Person2#: I'm flexible, so any day that works for the clinic is fine with me. However, I would prefer to schedule it in the morning if possible.
#Person1#: Alright, I can check our schedule and see what we have available in the morning. How about [appointment date|Thursday, June 10th] at [appointment time|10:00 AM]?
#Person2#: That works for me! Can you please let me know the name of the doctor I will be seeing?
#Person1#: Certainly! The dermatologist available on that date is [doctor name|Dr. Johnson].
#Person2#: Great, thank you! Lastly, do I need to bring anything with me to the appointment?
#Person1#: Yes, please bring a photo ID and your [insurance|insurance card] with you. If you have any current medications, please bring those with you as well.
#Person2#: Alright, I will make sure to bring those with me. Thank you so much for your help in scheduling the appointment!
#Person1#: You're welcome! We're looking forward to seeing you soon. If you have any further questions, feel free to ask.
#Person2#: Actually, can you tell me what the cost of the appointment will be? Will my insurance cover it?
#Person1#: The cost of the appointment will depend on the type of visit and the services provided during the appointment. We accept most insurances, including [insurance|Blue Cross]. If you would like, we can check your insurance coverage to determine what your out-of-pocket expenses will be.
#Person2#: Yes, that would be helpful. Can you please check my insurance coverage?
#Person1#: Sure thing! Can you please provide me with your insurance policy number, the name of the policyholder, and their date of birth?
#Person2#: I apologize, I don't actually have insurance. Can you please let me know the cost of the appointment without insurance coverage?
#Person1#: Certainly! A consultation with our dermatologist costs [appointment cost|$150]. However, if the dermatologist determines that further treatment is necessary, the cost may vary depending on the type and complexity of the treatment. We also offer payment plans to help make our services more affordable.
#Person2#: Thank you for letting me know. I will keep that in mind. That's all I needed to know for now. Thanks for your help!

#Person1#: Excuse me. I've been waiting here for 15 mins. Do you know how often does No. 3 run?
#Person2#: Oh, it runs every 20 mins. You must have missed it, when you came here. It should be here any minute now.
#Person1#: It seems that you have got here at a good time. Do you have a bus schedule?
#Person2#: Yes, I do. You can go to the Transport Department to get yourself a bus schedule and a bus route map.
#Person1#: I see, thank you.

#Person1#: Hi, Jeannie, why have you come to school an hour early?
#Person2#: I wanted to get a front row seat and review one more time before the test, because I failed a course last term. Why you here so early, Jack?
#Person1#: I get out of my car here at this time everyday. You seem to be nervous about your lessons. Have you finished your review?
#Person2#: I've only been studying night and day for the last week. If I don't get an A in this class, I won't get the support of my country. Why do you seem so calm?
#Person1#: This class is really just a review for me. I've been learning it for 2 years.
#Person2#: That's lucky for you.
#Person1#: Jeannie, can you guess what the test will be like? Will it be difficult?
#Person2#: I hope not, but I'm still worried about it.
#Person1#: Well, cheer up. Hope for good luck.
#Person2#: Thanks for wishing me luck. I'm going to need it.

#Person1#: Hello. Milton Hotel. Can I help you?
#Person2#: I want a reservation. Can I have it now?
#Person1#: Of course. What kind of taste do you like for your dinner?
#Person2#: I prefer Chinese dishes.
#Person1#: Would you like to sit in a smoking section, a non-smoking section or an open one?
#Person2#: A non-smoking section.
#Person1#: I'm awfully sorry, but we haven't got the section left now. Would you like to wait for a while?
#Person2#: Not at all. An open section will do, too.
#Person1#: OK. See you then.

#Person1#: Good morning, Star Airline. What can I do for you?
#Person2#: I'd like to confirm a reservation, please. My name is Wang Lin. My flight is KF98.
#Person1#: I see. You are leaving for Berlin on July 23rd with Mr. Smith, right?
#Person2#: What? I am afraid you have made a mistake, I am leaving on July 21st alone.
#Person1#: Isn't your family name Lin?
#Person2#: No. It is Wang.
#Person1#: I am sonry. So you are loaving on Duty 21st and your seat is in the business section.
#Person2#: That's right. Thank you.

#Person1#: Alison, would you like to have some more? 
#Person2#: No thanks. I have had enough. 
#Person1#: Actually you haven't have much. 
#Person2#: To tell you the truth, I am on the diet. 
#Person1#: That sounds ridiculous. Why? 
#Person2#: Well, I am gaining weight these days, and I have to watch my calories.

#Person1#: Doesn't that cloud look like a bear?
#Person2#: No, it looks like a dog to me. That one over there looks like a bear.
#Person1#: No, it doesn't. That one looks like a cat.
#Person2#: The sun is setting. Let's leave, so we can make it to my mom's on time for dinner.
#Person1#: OK. Where's the car? At the garden gate?
#Person2#: We parked it on the other side of that mountain.
#Person1#: No, I think we parked it behind that hill.
#Person2#: Oh, I see it. It's straight ahead by that tree.
#Person1#: Oh, good. We need to stop and buy some flowers. Your mom loves fresh flowers.
#Person2#: Sure, I need to stop to get gas first though.

#Person1#: How about going to dance this evening, Jane? You will find that the night life of this city is very interesting!
#Person2#: Good idea. There is a good nightclub nearby, isn't it?
#Person1#: Yes, the dance hall is nice with various styles of music.
#Person2#: ( In the club ) Look at those people in the dance floor, they are so crazy.
#Person1#: That's rock and roll with fast tempo.
#Person2#: I like the slow dance. I am good at rumba and waltz.
#Person1#: Take it easy. The time for slow dance is the middle part of the party.
#Person2#: Let's find a quiet seat and sit down for beverage.
#Person1#: OK, follow me.
#Person2#: Listen, it is waltz. I like the elegant step of the old styles.
#Person1#: May I?
#Person2#: Sure.
#Person1#: ( When they are dancing ) You dance gracefully!

#Person1#: Do you have any plan to buy a house in this city?
#Person2#: Absolutely we need a house here. But what makes me upset is the prices in this city.
#Person1#: Our monthly salary can not buy one square meter of the house here.
#Person2#: It is depressing to hear the price goes higher and higher.
#Person1#: More and more people need to buy houses, but the market can not meet the needs, so this caused the bubble in real estate industry.
#Person2#: And the rich still wants to buy more, even though they have at least one house to live.
#Person1#: Have you watched the TV series, Humble Abode?
#Person2#: Yes, it displays some social problems and interprets the values of our white-collars.
#Person1#: I really, really want a house, even though it is small like a snail house.

#Person1#: It's a lot of work running a campaign, isn't it!
#Person2#: I had no idea when I volunteered to assist governor Brown with this campaign what I was getting myself into.
#Person1#: Hang in there. The hardest part is just about over.
#Person2#: How Ay years have you been working with him?
#Person1#: About 15. I've seen him work hard for a lot of good changes.
#Person2#: It's easier doing this kind hard work when I know that I trust the man behind the posters.
#Person1#: Did you know we're trying to talk him into considering a presidential campaign?
#Person2#: He would be good.

#Person1#: Hello, sir. Have you reserved already?
#Person2#: No, is there a single room left?
#Person1#: Yes, how long will you intend to stay?
#Person2#: For a week or so. Do you give discount for a week or more?
#Person1#: Yes, we give 5 % discount for a week and 12 % for 2 weeks.
#Person2#: All right. I will take a room for a week. Here is my passport.

#Person1#: How long have you been living in this city, Jack?
#Person2#: Let me see. I came to this city when I was 23 years old. So 5 years now.
#Person1#: Do you like living in the big city?
#Person2#: Not so much. Air pollution has become such a big problem here now.
#Person1#: So do you want to move to the countryside?
#Person2#: No. Life there is really slow and boring, and here in the city we can get fresh vegetables and even some rare kinds of fruit. How I wish the air in the city could be fresher. Perhaps, it could be if there were fewer cars.
#Person1#: I don't think it's that easy to solve the pollution problem.
#Person2#: So, how long have you been living here?
#Person1#: I moved here from the countryside only 2 years ago. But I'm already tired of the life here?
#Person2#: Do you want to move back to the countryside?
#Person1#: No. As you said, life in the countryside can be boring.
#Person2#: So will you keep living here?
#Person1#: No. I'm considering moving to a smaller city. You know, a city with fresher air and better traffic.

#Person1#: John, it's time to get up.
#Person2#: It can't be time to get up yet.
#Person1#: It is. Hurry up! You'll be late for school.
#Person2#: What's the time?
#Person1#: It's nearly half past seven.
#Person2#: My watch says ten past.
#Person1#: It's slow. Hurry up! The bus goes at twenty to eight.
#Person2#: Are you sure half past seven?
#Person1#: Positive. I'll put the radio on.
#Person2#: It's only seven o'clock. Your watch is fast.
#Person1#: No, it isn't. It's stopped. I forgot to wind it up last night.
#Person2#: I could have stayed in bed for another half hour.

#Person1#: You're not going to believe what happened today. You'Ve got to promise to keep it to yourself.
#Person2#: Sure, what gives?
#Person1#: Today Mr. Leo threw Sally out of class!
#Person2#: On the level?
#Person1#: I'll say. I knew Sally would finally show her true colors. When she got her final test results back from Mr. Leo, she started yelling at him. You should have heard her. I'Ve never seen anyone get so upset before. To make a long story short, it seems that Mr. Leo failed her because he caught her cheating.
#Person2#: That's no laughing matter. That means she'll have to take the whole course again. I can't believe she's going to have to start from the beginning.
#Person1#: It serves her right!

#Person1#: Hello, auntie. Is Andy in? I want to invite him over for the weekend. The great young singer Justin Bieber is giving a performance in the concert hall nearby.
#Person2#: Oh, thank you, Dirk. But I don't think Andy will be able to make it.
#Person1#: Why? Doesn't he like Justin Bieber?
#Person2#: He does like him. But there's something wrong with his stomach. He went to the doctors with your uncle for an examination today. He hasn't come back yet.
#Person1#: I'm sorry to hear that. I hope it is nothing serious.
#Person2#: I hope so, too. But he was in great pain this morning. I was really scared.
#Person1#: What do you think caused it?
#Person2#: I don't know for sure. Perhaps it has something to do with what he ate last night. He went to Mary's birthday party and ice cream was served there.
#Person1#: He likes ice cream?
#Person2#: You are right. He must have eaten too much.

#Person1#: Hello! Welcome to [clinic|Being Strong Center]. How may I assist you today?
#Person2#: Hi, I would like to schedule a dental appointment, please.
#Person1#: Of course! We'd be happy to schedule an appointment for you. Can you please provide me with some dates and times that work for you?
#Person2#: Yes, I am available on [date|June 15th] at [time|2 PM].
#Person1#: Great! We have an opening on [date|June 15th] at [time|2 PM]. Can I get your full name and phone number, please?
#Person2#: Sure, my name is [patient name|John Smith] and my phone number is [phone number|555-555-5555].
#Person1#: Thank you, [patient name|John Smith]. I have you scheduled for an appointment on [date|June 15th] at [time|2 PM]. Is there anything else I can help you with?
#Person2#: Yes, can you please confirm the location of the clinic?
#Person1#: Absolutely! We are located at [clinic address|123 Main Street, Suite 101].
#Person2#: Great, thank you for confirming that for me. One last thing, would you be able to tell me what the cost of the appointment will be? I have [insurance|Blue Cross] and I want to make sure it is covered.
#Person1#: Certainly! The cost of your appointment will depend on the services you receive. However, we do accept [insurance|Blue Cross] and we'd be happy to check your coverage to ensure that your appointment is covered. Please provide me with your insurance information and I will look into it for you.
#Person2#: Thank you! My insurance information is: [insurance company|Blue Cross] [insurance policy number|123456789] [insurance group number|987654321]
#Person1#: Thank you, I've checked your insurance information and it appears that your appointment is covered. However, there may be some services that are not fully covered by your insurance, such as cosmetic procedures. If you have any further questions or concerns about your insurance coverage, please let us know.
#Person2#: Thank you for checking! That's good to know. I don't have any further questions for now, but I will be sure to let you know if I do.
#Person1#: You're welcome! We're always here to assist you with any questions or concerns you may have. If you need anything else, please don't hesitate to reach out to us. Have a great day! Goodbye!

#Person1#: Our advertisement says English competence is a key requirement of this position. Then how do you think of your proficiency in written and spoken English?
#Person2#: I have learned English for 10 years, and I have passed College English Test Band 4 and 6.My spoken English is fairly good enough to express myself fluently.
#Person1#: What other foreign language do you speak?
#Person2#: I did self-study of Japanese in college, and I can carry on some simple conversations in Japanese.

#Person1#: I am not convinced by your explanation. Could you explain it?
#Person2#: Sorry, I really can't do that. There's little time left for us.
#Person1#: I can't accept your excuse. It's five o'clock.
#Person2#: Yeah. But I have an appointment with Ann.
#Person1#: Ok, sounds good. But I think it's your trick.

#Person1#: I'll try one of these on. ( The customer tries one of the shoes on. ) It's too big. It slides up and down my heel when I walk around.
#Person2#: Well, let's try a size ten. ( He gets another pair and the customer tries a shoe on. ) Looks like a perfect fit.
#Person1#: Not really. It pinches my toes.
#Person2#: I'm sure they'll be fine once you break them in.
#Person1#: I don't know. . . well, I guess I'll take them, since you don't seem to have anything better.
#Person2#: Thank you, ma'am. It's been a pleasure doing business with you.

#Person1#: Linda? Is that you? I haven't seen you in ages!
#Person2#: Hi George! It's good to see you!
#Person1#: What have you been up to?
#Person2#: I just opened up my own business not long ago.
#Person1#: Good for you! What are you doing?
#Person2#: I'm a professional party planner here in the city. I do catering and all that.
#Person1#: I knew some day I would be able to profit from your love of fun!
#Person2#: Well, I don't know about the profit part yet. But I am really having fun!

#Person1#: So how long have you been living in London?
#Person2#: Er, a couple of years. How long have you been working here?
#Person1#: Only a few months. I moved down here for the job. There was no work for me where I came from.
#Person2#: Where did you come from then?
#Person1#: I came from a small village called Arnside near Lancaster a year ago. There was nothing there. So I moved to London.
#Person2#: Do you enjoy working here in this restaurant?
#Person1#: Very much so.

#Person1#: Welcome back racing fans! My name is Rick Fields and, as always, I am joined by my partner in crime, Bob Copeland.
#Person2#: We're in the last stretch of this very exciting race, and Kimmi Rikknen is leading the pack with only four laps to go! They are heading to turn three and Lewis Hamilton tries to pass Rikknen! It's a close one and, oh no! Hamilton hits the wall!
#Person1#: He came in too fast, jammed on the breaks and spun out. We have a yellow flag and the pace car is making its way onto the track.
#Person2#: The cleanup crew is towing the heavily damaged car and the green flag drops! Rikknen is still in the lead with only two laps to go!
#Person1#: Smoke is coming out of his car! He seems to be having engine trouble! He makes his way into the pit, and Fernando Alonso takes the lead!
#Person2#: How unlucky for Rikknen, and this race is over ladies and gentlemen, Alonso takes the checkered flag!

#Person1#: Why don't you sit down and relax, darling?
#Person2#: I don't want to.
#Person1#: Well, come and talk to me then.
#Person2#: Certainly not.
#Person1#: May I turn on the radio then?
#Person2#: Turn on the radio? What for?
#Person1#: So that we can sit down together and listen to some music.
#Person2#: Listen to some music? And who'll cook dinner? Will you?
#Person1#: Ok, I will. But let's go to a disco after dinner.
